Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Market Intelligence's Covenant Monitoring Service offers precision and assurance to lenders and sponsors, mitigating downside risk and enhancing asset management. Designed for private credit lenders, BSL lenders, and PE sponsors, this service proactively monitors covenant compliance, identifies potential breaches early, and fosters stronger borrower-lender relationships. Backed by expert credit analysts and integrated with iLEVEL, it provides tailored solutions, dynamic reporting, and collaborative workflows, ensuring operational efficacy, regulatory compliance, and confidence in navigating market complexities.

Key Features.Description: Advanced monitoring proactively identifies potential covenant breaches, enabling timely intervention and risk mitigation.
Tailored monitoring solutions adapt to unique transaction structures and specific covenant stipulations for each loan.
iLEVEL software acts as a single source of truth, streamlining data ingestion and providing holistic covenant data management.
Structured setup, tracking, reporting, and compliance processes ensure thorough and efficient covenant monitoring.
Flexible service levels, from basic to advanced, cater to diverse client needs and budgets over multiple years.
Utilize iLEVEL's dashboards, Excel add-ins, mobile apps, and APIs for data-driven insights and enhanced downside protection.
Stay informed with timely notifications on covenant statuses, missing documents, and potential breaches.
Streamlined workflows and expert access enhance team collaboration and decision-making on complex covenant issues.

Product Overview.Overview: Corporate Actions, originating from IHS Markit and now part of S&P Global Market Intelligence, is a solution designed to automate and streamline the entire corporate actions and income processing lifecycle. From initial announcement capture and validation to comprehensive downstream processing, this solution offers extensive functional features with global coverage across major events, markets, and asset classes. It empowers financial institutions to boost productivity, concentrate on value-added services, and mitigate risk by providing real-time monitoring and control in a traditionally complex and error-prone operational area.

Key Features.Description: Automates the entire corporate actions process, from announcement capture to downstream processing, minimizing manual intervention.
Supports a wide range of global markets, event types, and asset classes, ensuring comprehensive coverage for diverse portfolios.
Minimizes operational risks associated with manual processes, data errors, and missed deadlines through automation and real-time monitoring.
Streamlines workflows and improves operational efficiency, allowing staff to focus on strategic tasks and value-added activities.
Provides intuitive management dashboards for operations staff to easily view, prioritize tasks, and monitor risk profiles.
Supports increasing trading and corporate actions volumes and complexity, enabling business growth without operational bottlenecks.
Offers a single code base solution shared across customers, reducing the total cost of ownership over time.
Includes vendor and custodian data scrubbing to create a golden record, ensuring data accuracy and consistency for downstream processes.

Product Overview.Overview: The Corporate Actions Solution is a unified platform designed to help businesses manage the complexities and risks associated with corporate actions. By combining validated golden-source data with an industry-leading processing platform, the solution empowers firms across various asset classes and client types to automate, strengthen, and accelerate their corporate actions processing, ultimately reducing risk and improving operational efficiency.

Key Features.Description: Access centralized and highly accurate corporate action data for nearly 3 million securities across 170 countries, ensuring informed decision-making and reduced operational risk.
Leverage customizable on-premise or hosted solutions tailored for custodians, banks, asset managers, and brokers, enabling flexible operational processes and system integration.
Utilize a web-based SaaS offering with pre-configured workflows, providing a rapid deployment option for institutions with smaller portfolios and user bases.
Empower front-office, middle-office, and clients with a self-service web portal for seamless interaction with the post-trade environment and improved information access.
Benefit from accurate and timely data that facilitates fully informed decision-making, minimizing errors and improving operational efficiency.
Equip portfolio managers, traders, and clients with superior, timely information to optimize investment strategies and improve overall portfolio performance.
Automate and standardize corporate action processes on an efficient and scalable platform, enabling your business to handle increasing volumes and expand operations seamlessly.

Product.Product Name: Corporate and Sovereign Bond Pricing Data

Product Overview.Overview: Access objective and transparent pricing and liquidity data for over 215,000 corporate, sovereign, agency, and government bonds. Our service utilizes a dynamic model, processing over 10 million unique daily quotes from diverse sources to produce a validated price for each security. Customers receive a comprehensive bond pricing service that includes full transparency into the depth of the price sources, a liquidity score reflecting the frequency and breadth of pricing, and extensive analytics.

Key Features.Description: Gain confidence with data derived from a valuation process driven by multiple observable sources.
Receive assistance from expert evaluators who support all pricing inquiries and evaluations.
Access pricing data when you need it, with options for multiple intraday snaps and end-of-day price files.
Understand the data behind the numbers with detailed information on the observed inputs provided for each bond's evaluation.
Integrate data easily into your workflow with multiple delivery options, including SFTP, Portfolio Valuations, or a web-based Price Viewer portal.
Obtain a clearer market picture with additional independent bond liquidity metrics provided for each security.

Product Overview.Overview: The Corporate Emissions dataset, originating from IHS Markit and offered by S&P Commodity Insights, provides standardized data and analytics on greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions across the global energy value chain and industrial sectors. This comprehensive dataset covers over 18,000 facilities and 4,500 companies globally, offering insights at regional, sector, facility, corporate, and portfolio levels.  With coverage of Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions, forward-looking data up to 2030, and a history starting from 2010, Corporate Emissions supports critical workflows such as market analysis, benchmarking, and portfolio analysis for businesses focused on decarbonization.

Key Features.Description: Access emissions data for over 18,000 facilities and 4,500 companies worldwide, providing a comprehensive global view.
Analyze emissions across various industries within the energy and utilities and industrials sectors for targeted insights.
Utilize projections up to 2030 to anticipate future emissions trends and inform strategic planning.
Track Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions for a holistic understanding of carbon footprints across the value chain.
Leverage both absolute emissions and emission intensities to suit diverse analytical and reporting needs.
Benefit from a reliable and structured data model designed for in-depth GHG emissions analytics.
Obtain data via API and Connect platforms for seamless integration into existing workflows.
Analyze long-term trends with data history initiated in 2010, offering valuable context and perspective.

Product Overview.Overview: The Corporate Sustainability Assessment (CSA) is a globally recognized and independent benchmark used by companies to measure and communicate their sustainability performance. It serves as a comprehensive tool for businesses to align their sustainability efforts with their overall corporate strategy, providing valuable insights for both internal improvements and external stakeholder engagement. By participating in the CSA, companies can gain a clear understanding of their strengths and weaknesses in sustainability, benchmark against industry peers, and effectively communicate their sustainability story to investors and other key stakeholders, ultimately driving sustainable value creation.

Key Features.Description: Gain a robust and independent evaluation of your company's sustainability performance against industry leaders.
Develop and implement a successful and integrated sustainable business strategy based on CSA insights.
Identify and mitigate sustainability-related risks while uncovering new business opportunities through comprehensive analysis.
Effectively communicate your sustainability performance and strategy to the growing base of sustainability-focused investors.
Meet and exceed the expectations of diverse stakeholders, fostering trust and strengthening relationships.
Achieve external and internal recognition for your sustainability leadership and commitment.
Integrate sustainability thinking and practices deeply within your organization's culture and operations.
Improve your company's potential for inclusion in leading global sustainability indices like the Dow Jones Sustainability Indices (DJSI).

Product Overview.Overview: The Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) Solution from S&P Global Sustainable1 is designed to help companies and financial institutions navigate the complexities of CSRD reporting. This comprehensive solution provides invaluable insights and tools for assessing ESG impacts, risks, and opportunities, conducting materiality assessments and gap analyses, and performing climate and nature risk evaluations. It empowers organizations to measure financial impacts, track greenhouse gas emissions, and set reduction targets, ultimately supporting compliance with CSRD requirements and alignment with global sustainability trends like the European Green Deal.

Key Features.Description: Offers a complete solution for CSRD reporting, addressing various aspects from impact identification to target setting.
Facilitates the identification of ESG impacts, risks, and opportunities through double materiality assessments, a key component of CSRD.
Performs detailed gap analyses and provides actionable roadmaps to guide companies in meeting CSRD reporting requirements.
Enables the conduction of climate and nature risk assessments, crucial for understanding and mitigating environmental risks.
Supports the measurement of financial impacts related to sustainability, linking ESG performance to financial outcomes.
Assists in tracking greenhouse gas emissions and setting science-based reduction targets, aligning with climate goals.
Leverages Sustainable1 mapped datasets to ensure data accuracy and consistency, reducing reporting errors.
Provides comprehensive sustainability data to support informed strategic decision-making and improve overall sustainability performance.

Product Overview.Overview: The Corporate Yield Curves dataset provides a comprehensive point-in-time view of the corporate bond market by aggregating thousands of indicative quotes into daily group curves.  Organized by currency, sector, and rating, this dataset is essential for financial professionals needing robust data for transfer pricing, credit analytics, and accounting analysis such as discounted cash flow valuations.  Transparency is enhanced through excel templates that detail the fit of the group curves relative to observed data points.

Key Features.Description: Access Credit Spread and All-in Yield term structures ranging from 1 month to 30 years, providing a detailed view of yield curves.
Data is available in four major currencies: United States Dollar, Euro, Pound, and Australian Dollar, catering to global financial analysis.

Includes the top 11 GICS sectors, along with aggregated curves for all corporates, non-financial corporates, investment grade, and high yield classifications, offering extensive market representation.
Spans seven credit ratings from AAA to CCC, allowing for precise risk assessment and segmentation in analysis.
Receive daily data updates, ensuring timely insights and reflections of the most recent market conditions.
Utilize point-in-time data for valuations and analyses requiring a snapshot of market conditions on a specific date.
Leverage excel transparency templates to understand and validate the curve fitting methodology and data accuracy.
Access the dataset through various channels including API, Cloud, Desktop, and Feed, accommodating diverse technical infrastructures and workflows.

Product Overview.Overview: Navigate the complexities of counterparty credit risk management with our specialized solution. Designed to address the critical aspects of regulatory compliance, particularly for SA CCR and IMM frameworks, this solution keeps you informed and prepared. Stay ahead of evolving regulations and effectively manage your counterparty credit risk exposures.

Key Features.Description: Stay informed on the latest counterparty credit risk regulations, ensuring your institution adheres to standards like SA CCR and IMM.
Efficiently manage and calculate counterparty credit risk exposures using the Standardized Approach (SA CCR) with our comprehensive tools.
Confidently implement and manage the Internal Model Method (IMM) for a more sophisticated and risk-sensitive approach to credit risk assessment.
Access and leverage market intelligence to gain deeper insights into factors influencing counterparty credit risk.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Ratings' Counterparty Instrument Ratings (CIRs) are forward-looking opinions on an issuer's creditworthiness concerning specific financial obligations within securitization structures, particularly those involving counterparties like swap providers or liquidity facilities.  A CIR evaluates an issuer's ability and willingness to meet these obligations on an ultimate payment basis, considering credit enhancements and structural aspects like collateral.  These ratings are specific to the financial obligations under counterparty contracts in securitization transactions and are long-term assessments, focusing on the capacity to pay without regard to payment timeliness.

Key Features.Description: Each CIR is tailored to a particular issuer's financial obligation under a specific counterparty contract in a securitization, offering a highly relevant and precise credit risk assessment.
CIRs can be issued as public, private, or confidential ratings, accommodating different disclosure needs and strategic preferences.
CIRs can be assigned with ongoing surveillance or as point-in-time assessments, providing flexibility in monitoring and review frequency.
CIRs can be issued in local or foreign currency, reflecting the specific currency of the underlying financial obligation and transaction.
CIRs are long-term ratings that focus on the ultimate payment of financial obligations, offering a stable view of creditworthiness over time.
CIR is a distinct rating type with its own definitions, clearly differentiated from standard S&P Global Ratings issue or issuer credit ratings through the 'cir' suffix.
The 'sf' identifier is used when necessary to explicitly denote the CIR's application within securitization transactions.
CIRs assess the capacity to meet financial obligations as funds become available, concentrating on the fundamental ability to pay rather than strict payment deadlines.

Product Overview.Overview: Counterparty Manager is the industry-standard solution for streamlining and automating the complex process of counterparty onboarding and data exchange. It facilitates the secure sharing of crucial entity data, including client, tax, regulatory, and constitutional documents, essential for account onboarding, KYC, credit, tax, and legal reviews. By digitizing data and automating workflows, Counterparty Manager helps financial institutions reduce risks associated with manual processes, ensure regulatory compliance, and accelerate the establishment of trading relationships.

Key Features.Description: Streamline and customize the entire onboarding process for various counterparties with built-in workflows, significantly reducing manual effort and accelerating setup times.
Access a wide and validated network of trading counterparties, simplifying data and document exchange and ensuring data accuracy through pre-validated information.
Quickly and effectively exchange thousands of bilateral agreements, drastically speeding up the establishment of trading relationships and reducing time-to-market.
Address a broad spectrum of global regulatory requirements including ASIC, Dodd-Frank, EMIR, FATCA, and MiFID II, ensuring adherence to international standards and minimizing compliance risks.
Digitize data and documentation to enable in-depth analysis and maintain a comprehensive audit trail, enhancing transparency and simplifying regulatory reporting and risk management.
Digitize, analyze, and leverage intelligence from various document types like tax, formation, AML, regulatory, and legal documents, transforming static documents into actionable data.

Product Overview.Overview: Counterparty Manager: Onboarding Accelerator is a customizable, end-to-end solution designed to revolutionize new account onboarding for the financial services industry. Addressing the challenges of slow, manual, and opaque onboarding processes, this solution streamlines workflows for brokers, custodians, corporates, fund admins, managers, and service providers. Built on the industry-standard Counterparty Manager platform, it integrates entity data, document management, KYC, tax validation, regulatory compliance, legal agreements, and operational setup.  By automating and standardizing onboarding, Counterparty Manager: Onboarding Accelerator significantly reduces onboarding time, decreases costs, improves client experience, and enhances transparency and control.

Key Features.Description: Onboard new accounts and deploy capital faster, reducing the average onboarding time significantly.
Improve the onboarding experience for clients with a more transparent, efficient, and streamlined process.
Decrease the overall cost of onboarding by automating manual tasks and reducing errors.
Provide greater transparency throughout the onboarding process for all stakeholders, improving communication and trust.
Standardize onboarding workflows and automate key steps to eliminate manual work and inconsistencies.
Establish robust controls and comprehensive audit trails to ensure compliance and reduce risk.
Reduce operational risk associated with manual processes and inconsistent data management in onboarding.
Contribute to sustainability efforts by reducing paper-based processes and promoting digital workflows.

Product Overview.Overview: The Country Risk dataset from IHS Markit provides a comprehensive 360-degree perspective on global risks, offering extensive historical and forecast data. It covers country-level risk ratings, ESG factors, banking sector vulnerabilities, and political and security events. This dataset equips users with critical insights into geopolitical, economic, and security landscapes, enabling informed decision-making and risk mitigation strategies.

Key Features.Description: Access risk ratings for 211 countries, spanning geopolitical, security, economic, banking, and investment risks, with a 12-month forward-looking score and a 3-year directional outlook.
Utilize an ESG risk scoring system encompassing 44 factors to evaluate sovereign-level environmental, social, and governance risks, featuring a 12-month forecast.
Leverage monthly updated data from central banks and regulators, including balance sheets, income statements, and financial soundness indicators for over 100 countries.
Monitor daily updated intelligence events documenting political violence and risk incidents, systematically collected and structured for in-depth analysis.
Benefit from both historical data and forward-looking forecasts to understand risk trends and anticipate future challenges.
Analyze risk across 211 countries worldwide, gaining a truly global perspective on diverse risk factors.
Apply the dataset's insights across various industries including Consumer, Energy, Financials, Healthcare, Industrials, and more.
Access data through API, Cloud, Desktop, or Feed, and platforms like Marketplace Workbench, S&P Capital IQ Pro, Snowflake, and Xpressfeed™.

Product Overview.Overview: Covenant Monitoring by S&P Global Market Intelligence offers precision and assurance for robust downside protection, empowering lenders and sponsors with enhanced asset management to mitigate risk. This pinnacle solution optimizes operational efficacy and strengthens risk mitigation, tailored for private credit lenders, BSL lenders, and PE sponsors. It proactively shields against compliance pitfalls through meticulous monitoring, ensuring adherence to lending arrangements, preempting risks, and safeguarding against costly defaults, ultimately fostering financial resilience and efficient resource allocation.

Key Features.Description: Proactively identify potential covenant breaches, enabling timely intervention and mitigation.
Bespoke monitoring solutions adapt to diverse loan structures and specific covenant requirements.
iLEVEL integration provides a single source of truth for streamlined covenant data management and holistic oversight.
Efficient processes for setup, tracking, reporting, and compliance management within iLEVEL.
Flexible service packages ranging from basic to advanced, accommodating diverse client needs and budgets over multiple years.
Dynamic reporting and analytics within iLEVEL deliver data-driven insights for informed decision-making and enhanced risk mitigation.
Stay informed with timely alerts on covenant status, missing documents, and potential breaches, ensuring stakeholders are always up-to-date.
Facilitate teamwork and access specialist advice from seasoned credit analysts for navigating complex covenant challenges and optimizing compliance.

Product Overview.Overview: Credit Analytics is a comprehensive solution designed for global counterparty credit risk analysis. This dataset provides timely, pre-scored credit information, empowering users to proactively identify weakening credit profiles and enhance their analyst surveillance processes. By leveraging market-driven and fundamental-based analytical models, Credit Analytics offers a holistic view of credit risk exposure through probability of default (PD) and credit scores. It facilitates early detection of credit deterioration, provides transparency into risk drivers, and enables scenario analysis, covering millions of public and private companies across diverse industries and geographies.

Key Features.Description: Leverages market and fundamental data to deliver Probability of Default (PD) and credit scores that broadly align with ratings from S&P Global Ratings, ensuring reliable credit risk assessments.
Provides timely early warning indicators to monitor credit deterioration, enabling users to act swiftly and confidently to mitigate potential risks.
Offers clear insights into the drivers of default risk and allows for conducting scenario analyses to understand potential impacts under various conditions.
Accesses over 14 million pre-scores for public and private companies across 160 industries, 183 countries, and 241 S&P Dow Jones Indices, ensuring broad market representation.
Incorporates Country, Industry, and Index level Benchmarks, facilitating comparisons of individual companies against their peer groups and identifying emerging trends.
Leverages systematic risk factors such as country and industry risk scores to provide a comprehensive and structured risk evaluation.
Includes company credit risk scores available in both global and localized scales, catering to diverse analytical needs and regional comparisons.
Provides access to over 18 years of credit history, enabling the identification of trends and in-depth credit quality assessments over time.

Product Overview.Overview: Credit Analytics Web Services is an on-demand solution for global counterparty credit risk analysis. Seamlessly integrate these web services into your risk management framework to gain valuable risk insights, identify weakening credit, and enhance your analyst surveillance process. Leverage powerful analytical models to assess credit risk with outputs like Probability of Default (PD), credit scores aligned with S&P Global Ratings methodology, and comprehensive global model coverage for various entity types including corporations, financial institutions, and SMEs, whether rated or unrated, public or private.

Key Features.Description: Leverage powerful analytical models to assess credit risk, including 1-year Probability of Default (PD) with term structures and credit scores aligned with the S&P Global Ratings methodology.
Analyze credit risk for a wide range of global entities, including large corporations, financial institutions, SMEs, and both rated and unrated, public and private companies.
Incorporate comprehensive risk analysis by considering systematic risk factors such as country and industry risk in addition to financial data.
Utilize intuitive imputation logic to effectively assess credit risk even for companies with incomplete financial information.
Evaluate counterparty creditworthiness under various macroeconomic scenarios by leveraging the Macroscenario Model.
Benefit from the LossStats Model to calculate LGD, expected loss, and recovery for loans and bonds of any tenure.
Gain complete transparency with clear insights into factor contributions and sensitivities for both financial and non-financial scoring elements.
Leverage the ability to batch score counterparties to efficiently identify and monitor trends in credit quality across your portfolio.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Market Intelligence’s Credit Assessment Scorecards are essential tools designed for credit and investment professionals to effectively identify and manage potential default risks across a wide range of entities, including private, public, rated, and unrated companies, as well as government bodies. These scorecards offer broad sector and geographic coverage and enable the integration of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors into the credit risk analysis process, providing a transparent and structured approach to risk management.

Key Features.Description: Generate numerical scores that are broadly aligned with S&P Global Ratings’ criteria and validated by historical default data since 1981.
Combine point-in-time and forward-looking qualitative factors with quantitative drivers for a holistic picture of credit risk.
Access broad sector and geographic coverage with over 70 scorecards, spanning major asset classes, governments, real estate, and project finance.
Apply industry-leading benchmarks with 140 industry and country risk scores to enhance your analysis.
Improve transparency and reporting by incorporating ESG credit risk factors within the scorecard framework for rigorous fundamental credit analysis.
Utilize specialized scorecards to assess credit risk in over 100 infrastructure and industrial projects within the unrated universe.
Consistently measure and evaluate credit risks across diverse Alternative Investment Funds with varying strategies and structures.

Employ the CREST Scorecard for a single-source solution that consolidates Probability of Default (PD) and Loss Given Default (LGD) scoring for commercial real estate loans across multiple property types.

Product.Product Name: Credit Assessment Scorecards with ESG Credit Metrics

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Market Intelligence's Credit Assessment Scorecards with ESG Credit Metrics provide a transparent and structured framework for integrating Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) factors into credit risk analysis. These enhanced scorecards enable users to understand the impact of individual ESG factors on credit exposure by quantifying their effect on credit scores. Leveraging a proven methodology and incorporating 150 years of S&P Global expertise, these scorecards offer a consistent, auditable, and regulation-aligned solution for assessing credit risk while explicitly considering material ESG factors within the standard credit assessment process.

Key Features.Description: Understand the impact of environmental, social, and governance factors on credit risk by explicitly including ESG credit risk factors within the scorecard framework.
Access a framework that clearly outlines all risk factors, weights, benchmarks, and scoring algorithms, ensuring methodological transparency in credit assessments.
Generate alpha-numeric ESG credit metrics that quantify the impact of ESG credit risk factors on the final credit score, facilitating internal and external reporting requirements.
Utilize a granular rating scale and perform sensitivity, scenario, and stress tests to effectively identify and analyze default risk.
Benefit from detailed technical documentation describing the analytical and statistical processes, data usage, and performance testing results for regulatory compliance and transparency.
Receive scorecard implementation and application training workshops, along with ongoing analytical support to ensure your team leverages the latest analytical trends and best practices.
Employ a standardized and transparent structure that allows for year-over-year and analyst-to-analyst replicability, ensuring easy auditability of credit assessments.

Utilize a solution aligned with Bank for International Settlements (BIS) and International Financial Reporting Standards 9 (IFRS 9) regulations, meeting key industry standards for credit risk assessment.

Product Overview.Overview: Credit Assessments provide a preliminary, confidential evaluation of creditworthiness for unrated entities or financing structures, distinct from formal credit ratings. They offer an indicative opinion, expressed using rating symbols, to help companies understand their credit strengths and weaknesses. This service is designed to be less resource-intensive than a full credit rating, allowing companies to explore their credit profile, identify potential strategic issues, and gauge the feasibility of pursuing a formal credit rating, all while maintaining confidentiality and without committing to ongoing surveillance.

Key Features.Description: Provides an opinion on the creditworthiness of unrated entities or proposed financing structures, expressed in descriptive terms or rating categories.
Allows companies to examine their credit particulars and identify strategic issues without the commitment of a full rating analysis.
Requires less management time and cost compared to a full credit rating, making it an efficient initial step.
Helps management pinpoint potential strategic credit-related challenges early in the assessment process.
Can serve as a stepping stone to a more detailed public rating analysis if the assessment level is acceptable.
Credit Assessments are confidential and not publicly disclosed, offering privacy and discretion.
Represents an evaluation at a specific moment, providing a snapshot of creditworthiness without ongoing surveillance.
Uses traditional credit rating symbols (in lowercase) for easy understanding and comparison to formal ratings.

Product Overview.Overview: CreditCompanion™ is a powerful generative AI chatbot integrated into RatingsDirect®, designed to revolutionize credit research for financial professionals. By leveraging advanced Natural Language Processing and Large Language Models, it provides an intuitive chat interface to efficiently access, analyze, and summarize the extensive credit ratings and research from S&P Global Ratings. This cutting-edge tool streamlines workflows by quickly compiling comprehensive summaries, extracting key insights, and generating custom company lists, ultimately saving credit analysts significant time on routine tasks and enhancing their overall productivity.

Key Features.Description: Simplifies access to S&P Global Ratings data and research through an intuitive chat interface, helping you find relevant information quickly.
Instantly generates detailed company credit summaries, peer comparisons, and customized ratings lists to accelerate your analysis.
Quickly gathers and compiles summaries on specific entities, peers, sectors, and macroeconomic trends to keep you informed.
Extracts key insights from an extensive database of over 1 million credit ratings and three years of S&P Global Ratings research.
Ensures you can confidently rely on responses by providing thorough links to the relevant S&P Global Ratings source documents.
Optimizes your workflow and saves considerable time on routine research tasks, allowing you to focus on higher-value analysis.

Product Overview.Overview: Credit Estimates are a confidential, non-rating indication of S&P Global Ratings' likely credit rating for unrated entities, primarily used in the context of Collateralized Debt Obligations (CDOs). Formulated from an abbreviated analysis drawing upon analyst expertise, they are requested by third parties and do not involve direct contact with the obligor.  Credit Estimates are not a substitute for a formal credit rating and are based on information from the requesting party and reliable third-party sources. They provide a point-in-time analysis and are typically used to support ratings on CDOs by including unrated collateral.

Key Features.Description: Provides a private, preliminary view of potential creditworthiness for unrated entities.
Specifically designed to support the rating process for Collateralized Debt Obligations.
Generally used within a portfolio context, offering insights into broader credit risk.
Formulated using the analytical experience and expertise of S&P Global Ratings analysts.
Offers a streamlined assessment process compared to full credit ratings.
Available upon request from parties other than the entity being assessed.
Provides a snapshot of creditworthiness at a specific moment, with potential for updates.
Enables the inclusion of unrated collateral in CDOs and other structured finance obligations.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Ratings provides expert credit ratings, serving as trusted opinions on credit risk and empowering informed, confident decision-making. As a leading provider in global financial markets, they offer accessible insights and valued perspectives, driving clarity and growth. With over 1 million credit ratings outstanding, a global team of 1,500+ credit analysts, and ratings spanning 150+ countries, S&P Global Ratings delivers essential intelligence through Public, Private, and Confidential rating options tailored to diverse needs.

Key Features.Description: Increase your reach to new markets, engaging with issuers and investors across diverse sectors worldwide, including Corporates, Financial Institutions, and Governments.
Benefit from 150 years of credit market expertise and over 1 million credit ratings, ensuring informed decisions grounded in deep industry knowledge.
Improve corporate transparency and gain market clarity through accessible insights and valued perspectives that foster market growth.
Leverage authoritative, forward-looking insights on credit risks, provided by expert analysts and economists with extensive credit coverage.
Gain recognition and trust from investors; S&P Global Ratings are referenced by 95% of top global institutional investors, making them an essential market information source.
Choose from Public, Private, and Confidential Ratings to suit varied distribution needs and confidentiality requirements.
Access credit ratings based on 150+ countries, supported by a worldwide network of over 1,500 experienced credit analysts.

Product Overview.Overview: CreditPro® is a comprehensive solution designed to provide a complete understanding of credit risk exposures. It grants users access to authoritative default, transition, and recovery data, coupled with powerful database and analytical tools. This enables users to enhance the rigor and accuracy of their credit risk assessments, evaluate probabilities of default, track credit transitions, and capture critical credit loss information. CreditPro® empowers professionals to stay informed on regional and sector-specific credit trends, ultimately facilitating more informed and robust risk management strategies.

Key Features.Description: Gain a holistic view of your credit risk exposures with access to default, transition, and recovery data.
Improve the accuracy and reliability of your credit risk evaluations using powerful analytic tools and methodologies.
Assess the likelihood of default using dynamic databases and extensive historical ratings data.
Monitor and compare credit rating behavior over time to refine your risk assessments based on market trends.
Access and analyze the latest default and recovery trends, including data on a vast number of defaulted bank loans and companies.
Leverage S&P Global Ratings data covering a wide range of companies, securities, and sovereign ratings globally.
Integrate rating transition matrices and default/recovery rates tailored to your specific portfolio and risk requirements.
Evaluate future scenarios and benchmark internal performance to align with industry best practices in credit risk management.

Product Overview.Overview: CreditWire® on Bloomberg provides seamless access to S&P Global Market Intelligence's credit ratings and research directly within the Bloomberg Professional™ platform. This service acts as a centralized hub, delivering timely and comprehensive credit information essential for making informed financial decisions. CreditWire keeps users connected to the fixed-income market, offering in-depth analysis of credit trends and forces across various industries and sectors, making it an invaluable resource for financial professionals needing up-to-date credit insights.

Key Features.Description: Tailored for Sales & Trading, Risk Managers, Underwriters & Originators, and Institutional Investors, providing critical credit ratings and analysis for their specific needs.
Access ratings, news, and analysis for Global Issuers, Structured Finance, and U.S. Public Finance sectors, encompassing a wide spectrum of credit markets.
Stay ahead with real-time Credit News articles highlighting rating changes, potential shifts, and the factors driving upgrades, downgrades, and affirmations.
Gain deeper understanding through reports focusing on key risk and performance factors, alongside ratings rationales for issuers and instruments.

Benefit from data refreshed multiple times daily, ensuring you have the most current market intelligence at your fingertips.

Product Overview.Overview: Derivatives Studio, from S&P Global Market Intelligence, is a web-based platform providing on-demand, independent, and high-quality valuations for a wide range of derivatives instruments across credit, equities, rates, foreign exchange, and commodities.  This solution empowers users with an interactive and intuitive calculator to facilitate price discovery, compare valuations from various sources, conduct portfolio valuations, and perform in-depth analyses. Backed by extensive market data and expert support, Derivatives Studio enables informed decision-making through features like scenario analysis and historical valuations, catering to use cases such as pre-trade verification, market data adjustment analysis, bespoke valuation, and audit support.

Key Features.Description: Leverage valuations derived from a wide array of reputable sources, ensuring accuracy and independence for both liquid and illiquid instruments.
Access valuations across multiple asset classes including credit, equities, rates, foreign exchange, and commodities, all within one platform.
Utilize an intuitive calculator for price discovery, comparing valuations, portfolio assessment, and in-depth input analysis.
Conduct valuation scenario analysis and access historical valuations to understand market impacts and inform strategic decisions.
Verify OTC derivative valuations before trading to ensure fair and accurate pricing, minimizing potential risks.
Obtain transparent and independent valuations for audit purposes, aiding in regulatory compliance and reporting.
Access valuations on-demand through a web-based platform, enabling quick assessments and agile decision-making.
Rely on a dedicated team of derivatives experts for support, timely issue resolution, and a seamless client experience.

Product Overview.Overview: The Dividend Forecasting dataset, sourced from IHS Markit, offers independent predictions for dividend amounts and dates for over 28,000 global stocks, ETFs, and ADRs, extending up to five years into the future. Leveraging a team of 40 dividend analysts, this dataset delivers precise forecasts through bottom-up fundamental research, real-time company news, and a proprietary advanced analytics model. Financial professionals, including investment banks and hedge funds, utilize these forecasts to enhance investment strategies, price derivatives accurately, and gain a deeper understanding of dividend risk.

Key Features.Description: Stay informed with daily updates to forecasts, reflecting the most recent policy changes, company data, and earnings releases.
Access forecasts for over 28,000 stocks, encompassing equity and fixed income ETFs and ADRs across global markets.
Benefit from meticulously generated forecasts for each dividend amount, ex-date, record date, and pay date, backed by a trusted methodology.
Analyze historical trends with point-in-time forecasts available for key dividend event dates and amounts.
Discover market trends and understand potential risks with specialist commentary included within the dataset.
Leverage a deep historical perspective with data extending back to 2010 for comprehensive analysis.

Product Overview.Overview: This dataset provides daily point-in-time factor values for approximately 8,000 global companies across a wide range of industries including Consumer, Energy, Financials, Healthcare, Industrials, Materials, Real Estate, Technology, Media & Telecommunications.  Originating in 2011 and drawing data from a Dividend Forecasting Dataset, this dataset offers comprehensive coverage delivered via Cloud, Feed, Alpha Signals, Alpha Signals Web Portal, SFTP, and Snowflake, with daily reporting frequency and latency, and a size of 3GB.

Key Features.Description: Access data for 8,000 companies worldwide, offering a comprehensive global market view.
Covers diverse sectors like Finance, Technology, and Energy, enabling cross-industry analysis.
Data history back to 2011 allows for long-term trend analysis and backtesting.
Provides daily snapshots for granular market monitoring and timely decision-making.
Derived from dividend forecasting data, offering specialized insights into dividend-related investment strategies.
Delivered via Cloud, Feed, SFTP, and platforms like Alpha Signals and Snowflake for seamless integration.
Daily updates ensure access to the most current market information.
3GB dataset is optimized for efficient processing and integration into workflows.

Product Overview.Overview: The Dow Jones Best-in-Class Indices (DJBCI), formerly known as Dow Jones Sustainability Indices (DJSI), are designed to be leading benchmarks for investors focused on Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) factors.  These float-adjusted, market capitalization weighted indices, offered by S&P Dow Jones Indices in partnership with S&P Global ESG specialists, employ a best-in-class methodology to measure the performance of companies demonstrating leading sustainability practices within their respective industries. The DJBCI family provides a comprehensive suite of indices with geographical breakdowns including World, Regional, and Country options, as well as sub-indices that exclude companies involved in certain controversial activities, catering to a wide range of investor preferences and ESG objectives.

Key Features.Description: Identifies and includes the top-performing companies in each industry based on robust ESG criteria, ensuring a focus on sustainability leaders.
Leverages ESG scores derived from the S&P Global Corporate Sustainability Assessment (CSA), providing a deep and financially-material view of company sustainability.
Offers indices with World, Regional, and Country breakdowns, enabling investors to target specific geographical exposures within their ESG strategy.
As the first global ESG benchmark launched in 1999 (previously DJSI), it provides a long-standing and credible measure of sustainability performance.
Suitable for various use cases, including pre-screened universes for active management, benchmarks for ESG strategies, and underlying indices for passive and structured products.
Provided by S&P Dow Jones Indices, ensuring transparent, rules-based methodology and objective benchmarking for informed investment decisions.
Includes sub-indices that exclude companies involved in activities deemed unsustainable, allowing for tailored ESG investment approaches.
The CSA methodology goes beyond publicly disclosed information to provide a holistic and in-depth evaluation of corporate sustainability performance.

Product Overview.Overview: Economic Data from IHS Markit, available on S&P Global Marketplace, provides comprehensive, timely, and consistent data, coupled with robust forecasts spanning global economies and industries. This dataset is designed to empower users to identify and capitalize on opportunities worldwide by offering granular insights into country, territory, and industry-specific economic trends.  It includes a range of datasets from global and regional economic forecasts to consumer market and industry-specific outlooks, all accessible through S&P Global Marketplace's innovative platform featuring AI-powered search and blueprint tools.

Key Features.Description: Access detailed medium- and long-term economic forecasts for 206 markets and regional aggregates, enabling strategic planning and global market analysis.
Utilize timely historical macroeconomic and financial data from over 800 sources across 200+ markets for in-depth economic assessments and trend identification.
Gain granular insights into the US economy with detailed 10-year and 30-year forecasts, including specific regional, state, metropolitan, and county level data.
Understand the Canadian economic landscape with in-depth national and provincial level forecasts for informed decision-making in the Canadian market.
Explore forecasts for 36 consumer spending categories across 112 markets to identify evolving consumer trends and target specific demographics.
Compare performance metrics across 105 industry sectors in 75 markets to benchmark industry positions and identify competitive advantages.
Analyze forecasts for the global construction industry, covering residential and non-residential sectors across 74 markets to assess construction market opportunities.
Leverage a rich history of economic data initiated in 1900, with significant coverage from 1970 onwards, for long-term trend analysis and historical comparisons.

Product Overview.Overview: EDIN, from S&P Global Commodity Insights, is an online platform providing geologists, reservoir engineers, and business analysts with quick and easy access to continuously updated international E&P upstream and midstream data. Using standard web browsers, EDIN empowers users to generate, evaluate, and export the most recent oil and gas information, saving valuable time and resources on data storage and maintenance. By providing access to S&P Global's world-class data and expertise across over 200 countries, EDIN facilitates faster, smarter investment decisions in the energy sector.

Key Features.Description: Quickly identify and locate specific data elements within the extensive international E&P and midstream databases.
Visualize data on interactive maps by country, region, or basin for enhanced spatial analysis and understanding.
Generate comprehensive reports in PDF or interactive spreadsheets for in-depth data review, analysis, and sharing.
Examine trends and relationships in company ownership, production histories, and reserves through dynamic graphs.
Download data in various formats like ESRI, Google Earth, and Excel for seamless integration with your preferred tools and workflows.
Quickly learn and master the software with easy-to-follow, intuitive training resources, minimizing onboarding time.
Access continuously updated data ensuring you are always working with the latest insights for informed decision-making.
Leverage S&P Global's world-class, expert-backed data, saving time and resources on data validation and ensuring data reliability.

Product Overview.Overview: EDM for Energy: Rec&Sync is an Enterprise Data Management solution designed for the oil and gas industry to address the challenges of data duplication and inconsistency across multiple applications and projects. It delivers real-time monitoring, reconciliation, and synchronization of critical data, ensuring all users have access to the most accurate and up-to-date master dataset within their preferred application. By automating data management and providing a centralized view, Rec&Sync reduces manual effort, minimizes errors, and empowers informed decision-making based on consistent and reliable data.

Key Features.Description: Continuously tracks reference data values across applications and projects, instantly identifying discrepancies and changes as they occur.
Streamlines data management by automating the reconciliation process between different data versions across applications and projects, saving time and reducing errors.
Guarantees data consistency by synchronizing master attribute values, ensuring all users are working with the same, validated dataset within their chosen application.
Works with a wide range of data formats and structures, seamlessly integrating with S&P Global solutions and third-party applications used in the energy sector.
Maintains the integrity of static and reference data by providing real-time alerts when changes are made, ensuring users always access the most accurate information.
Provides a unified, centralized view of data across all projects and applications, improving data visibility and control for enhanced decision-making.
Maintains a full audit trail and data lineage, offering complete insight into data flows and historical activity for compliance and analysis.
Offers deployment flexibility with options for on-premise, cloud, or fully managed service via AWS, adapting to various IT infrastructure needs and scalability requirements.

Product Overview.Overview: The EDM Suite, a 2023 Waters Rankings Award winner for 'Best EDM System Provider' for the fourth consecutive year, is a comprehensive solution used by over 200 organizations across financial services, energy, and maritime industries.  It empowers businesses to automate complex data workflows, centralize and master diverse data sources to create a trusted 'gold copy', and eliminate organizational silos.  This suite provides validated, reliable data for informed decision-making, encompassing a core EDM platform with integrated investment data warehousing and reporting capabilities.

Key Features.Description: Manage diverse data types including entity, product, security, ESG, reference, position, and transaction data within a single platform.
Streamline data optimization and ensure robust support for various regulatory requirements and filings.
Automate data aggregation for factsheets, marketing platforms, and various reporting needs like valuation, performance, and transaction activity.
Facilitate complex investment analysis such as fund of funds allocation, look-through analysis, and ex-post risk assessment.
Access consistent, validated data, reducing operational risk and trade failures, and fostering confidence in data-driven decisions.
Automate manual, data-intensive tasks, freeing up resources for strategic, high-value projects and improving operational workflows.
Gain greater control and visibility over data lineage, access, and applied rules, enhancing data governance and compliance.
Break down data, technical, and functional silos, fostering collaboration and innovation across teams and departments.

Product Overview.Overview: Platts EMEA Gas & Power Market Data delivers the essential numbers for gauging the dynamic energy markets across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa. In today's complex energy landscape, this service provides timely and actionable data crucial for navigating rapid shifts in supply and demand. With comprehensive coverage spanning 11 natural gas hubs and 5 coal and power hubs, including renewables, carbon, and more, Platts empowers professionals to stay ahead, make informed decisions, and confidently navigate the ever-evolving energy sector.

Key Features.Description: Access daily price assessments that form the bedrock of your contracts, enabling you to capitalize on market changes and negotiate with confidence.
Dive deep into historical price trends and market patterns to refine your strategies and maintain a competitive edge with comprehensive historical data.
Gain broad visibility across EMEA with data from 11 natural gas hubs and 5 coal and power hubs, covering key markets like European gas, power, carbon, coal, uranium, and Guarantees of Origin (GOs).

Rely on Platts' widely respected, independent, and unbiased assessment process, built on diverse data sources, rigorous quality control, and adherence to IOSCO principles for dependable market insights.
Receive data in your preferred format via Platts Connect, cloud services, data feeds, or APIs, ensuring seamless integration into your existing workflows.

Product Overview.Overview: Navigate the complex and evolving energy markets of Europe, the Middle East, and Africa with EMEA Gas & Power Market Insights from S&P Global Commodity Insights. This comprehensive service delivers expert analytics and research, providing a detailed understanding of market dynamics through both quantitative and qualitative analysis. From real-time spot price markers to long-term strategic outlooks, it offers invaluable data and insights on natural gas, power, and broader energy markets, empowering organizations to thrive amidst fluctuating prices, policy shifts, and infrastructure developments. Access a wealth of market news, price assessments, research reports, and interactive data tools, all backed by a team of globally recognized experts, to confidently navigate daily trading and long-term strategic planning.

Key Features.Description: Stay informed with real-time alerts, daily news, and expert commentary on price fluctuations and market movements, ensuring you're always ahead of market-driving developments.
Access daily price benchmarks for natural gas across 11 hubs, plus power, coal, carbon, hydrogen and renewables, enabling accurate market valuation and informed trading strategies.
Leverage short-term market trend analysis and long-term strategic research reports to inform critical strategic planning and mitigate risks in investment and divestment decisions.
Utilize supply, demand, and price outlooks for carbon, coal, gas, and power markets extending to 2050, providing a robust foundation for long-term strategic planning and forecasting.
Stay ahead of policy changes with regular reviews of energy policy and regulatory developments across EMEA, ensuring compliance and anticipating market impacts.
Access critical gas, power, and renewables data through flexible formats including data tables, API access, and powerful analytics dashboards, tailored to your specific needs.
Gain granular insights into short-term gas market dynamics with high-frequency data on nominations, flows, storage, and demand projections, enabling agile operational adjustments.
Utilize long-term price forecasts and detailed scenario analysis, including planning and green cases, to 2050, to quantify uncertainties and inform robust long-term strategic decisions.

Product.Product Name: EMEA Gas & Power Risk Market Data

Product Overview.Overview: Navigate the complexities of EMEA gas and power markets with confidence using Platts EMEA Gas & Power Risk Market Data. This comprehensive service from S&P Global Commodity Risk Solutions provides an independent and verifiable source of forward curve data, essential for enhancing your risk management functions. Access over 30 forward curves and more than 2,000 daily forward prices across global locations, with extensive coverage of European gas derivatives and thermal coal markets. Leverage this data to make informed decisions, mitigate risks, and gain a competitive edge in today's uncertain commodity landscape.

Key Features.Description: Access over 30 forward curves and 2,000 daily forward prices, providing a broad view of the market.
Gain insights across major regions including Asia, Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA), and the Americas.
Leverage Platts PFC-Gas and PFC Power for detailed coverage of the European gas derivatives market across 9 different markets.
Access forward curve data for Thermal Coal delivered in the Amsterdam-Rotterdam-Antwerp region, looking ahead for 3 calendar years.
Utilize independent and verifiable data to improve risk assessment, hedging strategies, and overall risk management functions.
Make confident decisions on contract negotiations, trade strategies, and investment plans based on reliable market data.
Receive data through various methods including Platts Connect, API, FTP, CI Excel Add-In, and channel partners for seamless integration into your workflow.
Rely on editorially assessed and quantitatively derived forward curves based on defined methodologies, ensuring consistent and quality assessments.

Product Overview.Overview: Enerdeq™ Browser from S&P Global provides a streamlined online platform for accessing and analyzing North American Well, Production, and Activity data.  With access to over 5 million well completions and 2.5 million production entities, Enerdeq Browser empowers users to make critical E&P decisions by consolidating data management, streamlining workflows for acreage evaluation and prospect generation, and facilitating competitive analysis and opportunity identification, all within a single, user-friendly environment.

Key Features.Description: Access North American well, production, activity, rig activity and permits data from a single online repository, eliminating the need to search multiple sources.
Explore over 5 million well completions and 2.5 million production entities, providing a comprehensive view of the North American E&P landscape.
Optimize acreage evaluation and prospect generation with intuitive workflows designed to accelerate your analysis and decision-making processes.
Assess your competitive position and gain insights into oil well production trends to make informed strategic decisions.
Identify field outlines and potential oilfield service opportunities, enabling you to pinpoint new areas for growth and investment.
Navigate, annotate, and analyze data spatially on an interactive map, incorporating your own in-house data for enhanced visualization.
Instantly export your area of interest or entity data to Excel, shape files, or other applications for further in-depth analysis and integration with existing systems.
Create custom reports from scout tickets and production data, and receive timely email notifications for critical updates, ensuring you stay informed of key changes.

Product Overview.Overview: The Energy Price Forecast dataset from S&P Commodity Insights offers comprehensive energy market intelligence, providing both historical price data back to 1995 and forward-looking price forecasts for up to 30 years. Covering 9 key commodity groups including oil, gas, power, and energy transition commodities, this dataset enables users to improve trading strategies, make informed investment decisions, and manage risk effectively by understanding evolving market dynamics. Delivered via API and cloud platforms, the dataset offers monthly reporting frequency with intraday latency, ensuring timely access to critical market insights.

Key Features.Description: Access forecasts and historical prices across 9 commodity groups, including Oil, Gas, Power, LNG, Coal, Agriculture, and Energy Transition commodities, providing a broad view of the energy market.
Leverage both short-term forecasts (up to 36 months) and long-term forecasts (up to 30 years) to support both tactical and strategic decision-making in the energy sector.
Gain insights into market evolution with historical price data available monthly and annually from 1995, allowing for trend analysis and comparative studies of energy markets.
Enhance trading decisions with access to timely and comprehensive price forecasts and historical data, enabling more informed and potentially profitable trades in energy commodities.
Make better investment choices in the energy sector with reliable forecasts and historical context, reducing uncertainty and improving investment outcomes in energy markets.
Effectively manage risk by understanding future price movements and market volatility, using both short-term and long-term forecasts for proactive risk mitigation in energy portfolios.
Access data via API and cloud platforms such as AWS Data Exchange, Databricks Delta Share, and Snowflake, ensuring seamless integration into existing workflows and systems.
Stay up-to-date with monthly reporting frequency and intraday latency, ensuring you have access to the latest market insights and forecast revisions for timely decision-making.

Product Overview.Overview: Energy Studio: Impact is a web-based platform designed to transform big data into real-time energy analytics, providing insights across the entire energy value chain.  From upstream and midstream operations to emissions tracking and commodity pricing with integrated Platts market-based forward curves, Impact empowers geoscientists, engineers, asset managers, and financial analysts to accelerate commercial decision-making.  This platform allows users to analyze historical data spanning 163 years and project forward up to 55 years, enabling a comprehensive understanding of the energy landscape and facilitating faster, more informed strategic choices.

Key Features.Description: Significantly reduces time spent on data cleaning and normalization, allowing users to focus on analyzing and optimizing asset performance instead of tedious data tasks.
Provides quick and scalable review of type curve analysis for every producing well in North America, offering immediate insights into well performance and production potential.
Enables users to accurately predict future oil production by modeling various drilling and completion designs, optimizing well parameters before physical drilling.
Facilitates rapid identification of underperforming oil wells, allowing for strategic recompletion planning and targeted efforts to enhance asset performance.
Allows for easy benchmarking of assets against peers and competitors, enabling businesses to evaluate strategic effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
Simplifies and accelerates M&A candidate screening, focusing analysis on high-quality assets and enabling faster, more informed acquisition decisions.
Offers a single platform to track key energy metrics across the entire value chain, facilitating comprehensive KPI analysis and performance comparisons across companies.
Empowers investors to quickly shortlist high-ROI investment opportunities through unbiased comparable company analysis and access to comprehensive market trend data.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Commodity Insights Energy Transition services offer a comprehensive understanding of the global energy transformation, driven by consumer, investor, and political demand for sustainable energy sources. By integrating world-class energy expertise with deep knowledge across finance, technology, climate, and geopolitics, these services empower decision-makers to confidently navigate the complexities of the transition, providing essential tools and insights to steer towards a low-carbon energy future.

Key Features.Description: Access standardized data and analytics on greenhouse gas emissions across the global energy value chain and industrial sectors, coupled with price assessments for low carbon markets.
Gain comprehensive insights into clean energy technologies, including batteries & storage, hydrogen, wind, solar, and carbon sequestration, crucial for future energy system planning.

Develop strategic alignment with net-zero targets using integrated, long-term scenarios projecting energy use and emissions by fuel type, country, and sector, alongside risk assessment and portfolio strategies.
Leverage market-first price assessments that bring increased transparency, rigor, and integrity to voluntary carbon markets, supporting market growth and development.
Utilize the Atlas of Energy Transition as your visual guide to navigate the evolving landscape of sustainable commodity markets.
Analyze current emissions trajectories against various climate scenarios, including a 2-degree scenario, to inform critical future investment decisions.
Explore the dynamics of future low carbon supply chains, focusing on batteries, carbon capture, hydrogen and renewable gas, solar PV, and wind energy.
Understand oil and gas company emission targets and performance, government regulations, low-carbon technologies, and energy CAPEX forecasts within the upstream sector.

Product Overview.Overview: The Energy Transition Renewables dataset, provided by S&P Commodity Insights, offers comprehensive global capacity forecasts for wind and solar energy.  Covering both country and regional levels, the dataset provides projections in megawatts (MWs) extending to 2040, complemented by historical data reaching back to 2001. This resource is vital for understanding and navigating the energy transition, offering insights into renewable energy trends and market dynamics.

Key Features.Description: Includes data for solar, wind, and offshore wind generation types.
Provides data and forecasts at both country and regional levels worldwide.
Offers capacity projections extending out to the year 2040 for strategic planning.
Access historical data starting from 2001 for trend analysis and deeper insights.
Allows users to query data by both country and regional perspectives.
Delivered by S&P Commodity Insights, a reputable provider of energy and commodity market intelligence.
Enables informed decision-making regarding renewable energy investments and strategies within the energy transition.
Accessible via API for seamless integration into existing workflows and systems.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Commodity Insights' Energy Transition Forward Curves provide essential forward-looking data for stakeholders navigating the energy transition. These independently produced, market-based curves supplement spot market assessments to offer a comprehensive view of global energy transition markets, specifically covering daily settlement prices for CME CBL GEO, CBL N-GEO, and CBL C-GEO physically-delivered futures contracts from the Xpansiv CBL marketplace and NYMEX exchange. Published daily at the 2:30pm New York close for 48 forward months, these curves enhance transparency for informed business decisions and improved price risk management in the evolving energy landscape.

Key Features.Description: Make better informed infrastructure investment decisions by leveraging forward-looking data to optimize strategic assets in the energy transition.
Model prices, forecast market trends, and improve the evaluation of both physical and financial assets with access to reliable forward curves.
Calculate key risk metrics and P&L for portfolios with greater confidence using market-based forward curve data.
Design hedges that effectively preserve portfolio value and contribute to improved company profitability by managing price risk.
Report the fair value of financial instruments accurately using independently produced and market-validated forward curves.
Validate internally-derived curves against S&P Global Commodity Insights' market-based curves for increased accuracy and reliability.
Receive data directly to your desktop immediately upon publication, enabling seamless integration into proprietary models and systems.
Access the latest historical and reference data on a single screen, simplifying bespoke charting, reporting, and trader surveillance.

Product Overview.Overview: Enterprise Data Management (EDM) is a robust platform designed to centralize and harmonize your organization's diverse data landscape. It empowers businesses to establish data trust and transparency by acquiring, validating, and distributing critical data across trade, operations, risk, finance, and customer domains. EDM creates a single, consistent, and auditable version of truth, eliminating data silos and fostering data-driven decision-making for financial services, energy, and maritime & trade industries.

Key Features.Description: Consolidate data from various sources into a single platform, breaking down data silos and improving accessibility.
Establish trust in your data with robust technical and business validations, ensuring a single, golden source of truth.
Streamline workflows by automatically delivering validated data to downstream systems in the required format and at the right time.
Improve data governance and compliance with a transparent audit trail and a single, consistent view of data.
Minimize operational risks by using validated, enriched, and reconciled data from across your organization.
Adaptable for use across financial services, energy, maritime & trade, and other industries facing complex data management challenges.
Supports critical master data management use cases, including Security Master, Entity Master, and Price Master.
Build flexible data hierarchies and mastered datasets enriched and validated for downstream consumption.

Product Overview.Overview: An Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) Evaluation is a valuable tool for companies transitioning to a risk/reward approach, offering a forward-looking view of potential risk profiles and capital position changes in relation to risk drivers. This evaluation benchmarks an insurer's ERM practices against industry peers, providing a detailed analysis of the effectiveness of existing structures and controls using both public and insurer-provided data.  The assessment culminates in an overall ERM evaluation (superior, strong, good, adequate, or deficient) based on the scoring of risk culture, risk exposure management (including sub-scores for areas like liquidity and model risk), and risk optimization.

Key Features.Description: Understand how your ERM practices compare against a broad range of industry peers.
Utilize the Evaluation Summary to effectively communicate ERM insights to internal and external stakeholders.
Gain specific insights into the effectiveness of your controls for cyber risk and other key risks relative to your risk profile.
Determine the effectiveness of your programs in managing risks within defined tolerances to achieve business objectives.
Access detailed risk metrics to evaluate the performance of your risk controls.
Obtain a forward-looking perspective on your insurer's potential risk profile and capital position changes.
Benefit from a scoring system that evaluates risk culture, risk exposure management, and risk optimization for a comprehensive assessment.
Leverage an evaluation process that utilizes both public data and data provided directly by insurers for a robust analysis.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Commodity Insights' Environmental Registry is a centralized, financial markets-based platform designed for managing global carbon, water, and biodiversity credits.  Serving project developers, credit buyers, regulators, and standards bodies, this enhanced registry-as-a-service platform offers end-to-end environmental portfolio management, supporting both existing and emerging environmental programs.  With a 15-year legacy, the relaunched registry boasts increased transparency, efficiency, and scalability through robust infrastructure, streamlined workflows, improved data access, enhanced security, and seamless connectivity to the Meta Registry®, fostering growth and confidence in global environmental markets.

Key Features.Description: Manage all global carbon, water, and biodiversity credits in one convenient, financial markets-based system.
Experience a fast, user-friendly, and configurable platform that streamlines workflows and automates standard processes.
Benefit from a robust yet adaptable infrastructure that accommodates diverse methodologies and evolving market demands.
Gain better data access and utilize enhanced management tools for informed decision-making and portfolio oversight.
Rely on improved, financial-grade security measures to protect the integrity and safety of your environmental credit transactions.
Seamlessly connect to the Meta Registry® for broader market access and enhanced interoperability within global environmental markets.
Tailor account management, project registration, issuance, transfer, and retirement workflows, along with customizable dashboards, to meet specific program needs.
Leverage a flexible reporting suite with predefined, searchable, filterable, and exportable reports for all user types, ensuring transparency and accountability.

Product Overview.Overview: The Equity Deals Database is a global, comprehensive, and real-time dataset originating from S&P Global Market Intelligence (formerly IHS Markit), providing in-depth information on equity and equity-related primary and secondary offerings.  It covers the entire lifecycle of deals, from initial announcements and filings to pricing, withdrawal, and post-trade performance including lock-up periods.  This dataset is crucial for market participants seeking to understand competitive landscapes, analyze historical performance, and assess the overall health of the new issuance market, encompassing deal types such as IPOs, converts, follow-ons, blocks, SPACs, and ATMs.

Key Features.Description: Access real-time and historical data on equity deals from around the world, providing a comprehensive global market view.
Track deals from preliminary announcements to post-trade performance, including lock-up periods, for complete deal visibility.
Stay ahead of the market with near real-time reporting frequency, enabling timely decision-making based on the latest information.
Analyze a wide spectrum of equity deals, including IPOs, converts, follow-ons, blocks, SPACs, and ATMs, for in-depth market analysis.
Leverage historical data dating back to 2001 to identify trends, analyze past performance, and gain a long-term market perspective.
Rely on data sourced from regulatory filings, exchanges, press releases, and investment banks for accurate and trustworthy information.
Integrate data seamlessly into your workflows through API and Feed delivery channels for optimal accessibility.
Gain a competitive edge by understanding competitor activity, market trends, and new issuance market health with this comprehensive dataset.

Product Overview.Overview: The Fundamental Equity Risk Models dataset, offered by S&P Global Market Intelligence, provides robust risk forecasting and portfolio construction tools for short to medium-term investment strategies. Utilizing point-in-time datasets and the Alpha Factor Library, these models enable investment professionals to effectively manage portfolio risk, understand portfolio exposures, and perform in-depth attribution analysis. The dataset offers comprehensive coverage across various global regions and employs industry-standard GICS classifications, ensuring accuracy and relevance for diverse investment workflows.

Key Features.Description: Offering specific models for Australia, Canada, China-A Share, Global, Pan Asia Ex-Japan, Pan Europe, and the US, catering to diverse investment mandates.
Built using S&P Global Market Intelligence's Point-in-Time datasets, ensuring models are constructed with the highest level of historical data accuracy and timeliness.
Leverages comprehensively defined fundamental style factors from the AFL for state-of-the-art factor construction.
Utilizes widely recognized GICS industry definitions for consistent and comparable sector classifications.
Combines both medium and short-term risk perspectives into a single, integrated package for flexible analysis.
Empowers investment professionals to effectively manage portfolio risk and implement strategic risk budgeting workflows.
Provides insights into portfolio exposures, enabling a clearer understanding of overall portfolio risk drivers.
Facilitates detailed attribution analysis to evaluate portfolio performance and investment strategy effectiveness.

Product Overview.Overview: The ESG Bond Pricing & Reference Data dataset provides detailed information on ESG-related aspects of bonds, offering granularity at the bond level. It incorporates current standards and frameworks for green investing, enabling users to effectively support instrument screening, portfolio construction, compliance, reporting, and ongoing monitoring. Sourced from the Luxembourg Stock Exchange and S&P Global’s Bond Reference Data, this dataset is crucial for investors seeking to integrate ESG factors into their fixed income strategies.

Key Features.Description: Identify bonds with specific ESG labels (green, social, sustainability, transition, etc.) for targeted investment strategies.
Access detailed attributes covering use of proceeds, standards, SDGs, and external verification, providing a comprehensive ESG profile.
Understand bond impact with Key Performance Indicators and Sustainability Performance Targets linked to bond characteristics and potential coupon/redemption adjustments.
Benefit from a global dataset covering 10,000+ bonds across diverse industries including Consumer, Energy, Financials, and Technology.
Leverage data from reputable sources like the Luxembourg Stock Exchange and S&P Global Bond Reference Data for trusted insights.
Integrate data seamlessly through API and Feed delivery channels on API and SFTP platforms.
Stay current with daily reporting frequency and dataset latency for timely decision-making.
Utilize a dataset with 10s of fields, offering rich information for in-depth analysis.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Ratings ESG Evaluation is designed to provide companies with a forward-looking and relative analysis of their sustainability efforts, helping investors gain a deeper understanding of their strategy, purpose, and management quality.  In a world where ESG considerations are increasingly vital for investors, this evaluation addresses the challenges of inconsistent and non-standardized ESG information.
