Product.Product Name: Medium & Heavy Commercial Vehicle Engine Forecast

Product Overview.Overview: Gain a comprehensive understanding of the future commercial vehicle engine market with this 7-year forecast. Covering 43 countries and featuring over 20 technical engine attributes, this product provides critical insights into electric vehicle trends, OEM demand for parts, competitor powertrain strategies, and more. Part of a suite of trucking industry solutions, this forecast empowers strategic planning, global market analysis, and data-driven decision-making for OEMs, suppliers, and financial investors navigating the evolving landscape of medium and heavy commercial vehicles.

Key Features.Description: Access future trends and market shifts with regularly updated forecasts to ensure proactive strategic planning.
Understand worldwide market dynamics with data spanning 7 regions and encompassing 95% of global production.
Gain deep insights through comprehensive data covering a wide range of engine specifications for detailed analysis.
Leverage past trends and performance benchmarks with a decade of historical data for enhanced forecasting accuracy.
Analyze engine production by platform, model, plant, and engine installation for granular insights into specific market segments.
Evaluate competitor strategies and production capacities to gain a competitive edge in the commercial vehicle market.
Assess part supply volumes, launch timings, and plant production for efficient supply chain and production management.
Understand engine production start and end timings to anticipate market entries and exits for strategic decision-making.

Product Overview.Overview: The Medium & Heavy Commercial Vehicle Forecast dataset, derived from IHS Markit expertise, delivers comprehensive outlooks on the global commercial vehicle market (vehicles over 6 tonnes).  Utilized by key industry players including automakers, suppliers, financial institutions, and advisory firms, this dataset facilitates critical analyses such as demand cycle monitoring, manufacturer market share assessments, and understanding the evolving transition towards electric commercial fleets.  Forecasts are meticulously developed quarterly by a team of expert analysts, leveraging associate data, public manufacturer information, historical registration data, and extensive research.

Key Features.Description: Provides sales and production forecasts across regions, markets, and countries worldwide, offering a truly global view of the commercial vehicle landscape.
Includes strategic OEM group, sale parent, brand, and nameplate level data for detailed market share analysis and manufacturer performance tracking.
Offers design parent, platform, and program code details, enabling granular analysis of specific vehicle programs and their market impact.
Categorizes data by vehicle weight class and type (truck or bus), allowing for focused analysis on specific commercial vehicle segments.
Delivers regularly updated forecasts on a quarterly basis, ensuring users have access to the most current market outlooks.
Forecasts are developed by a dedicated team of industry analysts, combining diverse data sources and deep market understanding for reliable insights.
Empowers users to monitor demand cycles, analyze market trends, and gauge the shift to electric fleets, informing critical strategic decisions.
Leverages historical data initiated from 2000, providing a rich historical context for understanding current trends and forecasting future market developments.

Product Overview.Overview: The S&P Global Commodity Insights Meta Registry® is a web-based platform that brings clarity and efficiency to the complex world of carbon markets. By connecting environmental registries globally with carbon markets and participants, it fosters transparency and consistency. Utilizing advanced security and automation, the Meta Registry® seamlessly integrates and standardizes data from diverse programs and standards, offering a unified and secure view of the carbon market landscape. Built upon the foundation of S&P Global Commodity Insights' trusted reputation and deep industry expertise, this innovative solution provides a reliable and independent resource for navigating environmental markets.

Key Features.Description: Provides a clear, consolidated view of the carbon markets by connecting various environmental registries into a single platform.
Integrates and reconciles data from diverse environmental registries, standards, and programs, ensuring data consistency and reducing discrepancies.
Offers a user-friendly, web-based platform for accessing and understanding complex carbon market data and registry information.
Employs advanced security technologies to protect sensitive data and ensure the platform's reliability for critical market operations.
Leverages automation technologies to streamline workflows and enhance operational efficiency within carbon market processes.
Backed by S&P Global Commodity Insights' reputation as a trusted and independent voice in the carbon markets, providing reliable market intelligence.
Connects environmental registries and carbon market participants worldwide, facilitating a global perspective and broader market participation.
Empowers market participants with consistent and transparent data, leading to more informed and strategic decision-making in the carbon markets.

Product Overview.Overview: Methane Performance Certificates are designed to bring transparency and standardization to the natural gas market by allowing participants to differentiate and accurately price natural gas based on its methane emissions performance. These certificates establish a clear benchmark for methane emissions, enabling the market to recognize and reward responsibly sourced or cleanly produced natural gas.

Key Features.Description: Enables market participants to distinguish between natural gas sources and price them accordingly based on their methane emissions performance.
Brings clarity to the natural gas market by providing a standardized method for assessing and reporting methane emissions.
Establishes a consistent and reliable standard for evaluating and comparing methane emissions across different natural gas sources.
Facilitates the recognition and valuation of natural gas that is produced or sourced with a focus on minimizing methane emissions.
Encourages and rewards the production of cleaner natural gas by providing a mechanism for market differentiation and price signals.
Available through multiple delivery platforms including Gas Daily, Energy Trader, and Platts Dimensions Pro, ensuring broad market accessibility.

Product Overview.Overview: Mid-Market Evaluation (MME) from S&P Global Ratings is an independent assessment of mid-sized companies' creditworthiness, designed to enhance transparency and understanding within the mid-market sector.  It serves as a valuable tool for investors navigating this complex market, intermediaries servicing their clients, and mid-market companies seeking alternative funding sources. MME utilizes a purpose-built scale (MM1 to MM8) to benchmark credit risk and is delivered with a detailed report, offering options for public, private, or confidential disclosure to suit various needs.

Key Features.Description: Gain confidence with an unbiased assessment of mid-market company creditworthiness from S&P Global Ratings, a trusted global provider.
Navigate the complexities of the mid-market with improved visibility into credit risk profiles, aiding informed investment decisions.
Utilize a tailored MM1-MM8 scale designed specifically for mid-market companies, enabling accurate credit risk comparisons.
Unlock access to diverse capital sources beyond traditional bank lending by providing investors with a recognized credit benchmark.
Leverage a standardized, purpose-built scale to compare creditworthiness across different mid-market companies effectively.
Streamline private placement and direct lending processes with a shared credit language understood by investors and lenders.
Benefit from continuous monitoring and annual reviews, ensuring the MME remains a relevant and up-to-date credit assessment.
Rely on S&P Global Ratings' extensive global experience combined with localized market knowledge for comprehensive evaluations.

Product Overview.Overview: The Midstream Essentials: Energy Infrastructure Database, originating from IHS Markit and now offered by S&P Commodity Insights, provides comprehensive asset-level intelligence on the global oil and gas midstream sector.  This dataset delivers detailed information on transportation, processing, and primary markets infrastructure, encompassing over 4 million kilometers of pipelines and 120,000 facilities worldwide. Leverage this extensive resource to enhance infrastructure-led strategies across exploration, field development, supply chain optimization, and competitive analysis, gaining critical insights into assets ranging from pipelines and storage to processing plants and LNG facilities.

Key Features.Description: Access detailed attributes for each asset, including name, location coordinates, capacity, ownership, operational status, and online dates, enabling in-depth asset analysis.
Explore a vast network spanning over 4 million kilometers of pipelines and 120,000 facilities, providing a truly global perspective on energy infrastructure.
Gain insights across a wide spectrum of midstream assets, including FPSOs, pipelines, compressor stations, storage facilities, terminals, refineries, gas processing plants, and more.
Utilize this dataset to inform critical business functions such as infrastructure-led exploration, field development planning, supply chain optimization, and competitive intelligence.
Benefit from data originating from IHS Markit, a trusted source now part of S&P Commodity Insights, ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Access data history dating back to 2000, enabling trend analysis and a long-term understanding of infrastructure development.
Stay informed with daily reporting frequency and dataset latency, ensuring access to timely and relevant market intelligence.
Integrate data seamlessly through API or Feed delivery channels, and access via platforms like FTP and International E&P Content Database for flexible data consumption.

Product Overview.Overview: Mobility and Energy Future provides critical insights and data for businesses navigating the unprecedented transformation of the mobility and energy sectors. This service helps you understand the impacts of evolving technologies, regulations, business models, and consumer behaviors on the automotive, oil and gas, and utilities industries. By addressing key questions around electric vehicles, autonomous driving, energy demand, and policy shifts, it equips you with a scenario-based framework and in-depth analysis to make informed strategic decisions and capitalize on the trillions of dollars at stake in this evolving landscape.

Key Features.Description: Gain a deep understanding of the short and long-term trends shaping the future of mobility and energy to effectively develop robust business strategies.
Access monthly sales data and comprehensive analysis covering key markets, including detailed breakdowns of electric vehicle adoption and market dynamics.
Utilize long-term forecasts across multiple scenarios to navigate uncertainty and make informed decisions regarding future market developments.
Leverage specialized reports and analysis focused on zero-emission vehicles, including batteries, charging infrastructure, and relevant policies.
Understand the interconnected impacts on the automotive, oil & gas, and utilities sectors, enabling holistic strategic planning.
Benefit from direct access to industry analysts for expert consultation and deeper insights into complex market trends and developments.
Access data and forecasts spanning key global markets, providing a comprehensive international perspective on mobility and energy transitions.
Proactively identify potential risks and emerging opportunities to enhance preparedness and capitalize on market shifts.

Product.Product Name: Mobility Intelligence for Automotive Marketing, Field and Sales Operations

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Mobility Automotive Consumer Insights reports and databases offer a deep understanding of today's "connected" automotive consumer across eight key global markets. These surveys, encompassing 8,000 vehicles, delve into innovative technologies, new services, and connectivity as crucial factors influencing vehicle purchase decisions.  Gain the ability to pinpoint must-have features, evaluate consumer willingness to pay for advanced technologies, and effectively anticipate evolving market demands for novel solutions. Covering Connected Car, User Experience, E-Mobility, and Autonomous Driving, the deliverables include comprehensive PDF reports and datasets in Excel and SPSS formats for actionable intelligence.

Key Features.Description: Determine the specific services and features that are most critical to today's automotive consumers.
Assess consumer propensity to pay for advanced technologies and quantify their spending thresholds.
Proactively identify emerging market demands and trends in automotive consumer preferences.
Surveys span Connected Car, User Experience, E-Mobility, and Autonomous Driving for holistic insights.
Data gathered from eight key automotive markets (US, China, Germany, UK, Japan, India, Brazil, South Korea, and Thailand*) provides a broad understanding.
Receive insights through detailed PDF reports and versatile datasets in Excel and SPSS formats.
Leverage survey data from 8,000 vehicles to base strategies on robust consumer insights.
Choose from four distinct surveys to focus on specific areas of interest: Connected Car, User Experience, E-Mobility, or Autonomous Driving.

Product Overview.Overview: MobilityInsight is a comprehensive service designed to help businesses navigate the transformative shifts in the automotive industry driven by autonomous driving, electrification, and evolving mobility services.  It offers global mobility coverage and a 12-year forecast for key markets, providing crucial insights into emerging trends, disruptive technologies, and new business models. MobilityInsight empowers users to understand the changing landscape and capitalize on the opportunities presented by this industry-wide evolution.

Key Features.Description: Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the fast-paced mobility world through dedicated news coverage.
Gain deep insights into critical mobility trends such as electrification, autonomous vehicles, ownership models, and mobility services with detailed analytical reports.
Explore the dynamic landscape of new electric vehicle startups, with in-depth research and analysis using the unique EV-SURE rating system.
Access 12-year forecasts for light vehicle sales, parc, and vehicle miles traveled (VMT), broken down by ownership type, propulsion, and autonomy level.

Product Overview.Overview: CRISIL's Model Infinity platform is a comprehensive model inventory and workflow solution designed to centralize the management of models and associated activities. It offers a customizable interface tailored for various teams involved in the model lifecycle, including model risk managers, development, validation, and audit teams.  With integrated dashboards, automated documentation, robust search, and book-of-work planning, Model Infinity is a powerful tool for streamlining model risk management activities within financial institutions and organizations managing a significant number of models.

Key Features.Description: Create a single, organized system for managing all models and related activities, improving accessibility and control.
Adapt the platform to your firm's specific model risk processes with highly flexible and adaptable development, validation, and review workflows.
Streamline operations with smart features like auto-routing, email approvals, auto-versioning, and automated alerts and reminders.
Efficiently manage model documentation with features for hosting, categorization, and smart-indexing for easy retrieval.
Quickly locate information with a powerful search engine that indexes both document content and model metadata.
Choose between cloud-based or on-premise deployment to suit your firm's infrastructure and security requirements.
Provide customized interfaces for different teams (model risk, development, validation, audit) to optimize their specific interactions with the platform.
Utilize integrated dashboards, book-of-work planning, risk scoring, and reporting features to enhance overall model risk management.

Product Overview.Overview: The Money Market Directories (MMD) dataset offers comprehensive and in-depth investment details on over 277,000 global institutional investors, consultants, investment managers, family offices, insurance firms, and OCIOs.  This extensive dataset provides critical insights into investments and key decision-makers, empowering investment management firms, investment banks, and private equity firms to identify growth opportunities, build lasting relationships, raise capital, and streamline workflows by integrating MMD data into CRM systems for targeted marketing and revenue generation campaigns.

Key Features.Description: Access in-depth data on over 277,000 institutional investors worldwide, expanding your market reach and understanding.
Target specific segments with detailed information across institutional investors, consultants, investment managers, family offices, insurance firms, and OCIOs for tailored strategies.
Uncover comprehensive investment details to enable enhanced market analysis and more informed strategic decision-making.
Build valuable connections with access to contact information for key business decision-makers within institutional organizations.
Seamlessly integrate MMD data into your CRM systems to streamline workflows and enhance the effectiveness of marketing and sales initiatives.
Leverage historical data dating back to 1980 for trend analysis and gaining a deeper understanding of market evolution.
Choose from various delivery channels including Cloud, Feed, Snowflake, and Xpressfeed™ for convenient data access and integration.
Utilize thousands of data fields providing granular insights for detailed analysis, reporting, and a holistic view of the investment landscape.

Product Overview.Overview: The Municipal Bond Pricing dataset, provided by S&P Global Market Intelligence (originally IHS Markit), delivers independent mark-to-market pricing, transparency metrics, and liquidity scores for over one million US municipal bonds, encompassing both investment grade and high yield.  Leveraging a sophisticated methodology that incorporates state and municipality financial conditions, issue-level factors, real-time OTC pricing data, and MSRB data, this dataset provides intraday price updates and historical coverage back to 2011.  This robust pricing system, validated with a SOC 1 review, is designed to support price discovery, valuation, risk management, and portfolio analysis, offering users deep market insights and reliable data delivered through various channels including API, Cloud, and Feed.

Key Features.Description: Access pricing and analytics for over 1 million investment grade and high yield municipal bonds, ensuring broad market representation.
Benefit from intraday data refreshes, crucial for timely price discovery, accurate portfolio valuation, and effective risk management.
Gain deeper market insights with liquidity scores and visibility into dealer quoting and trading activity, improving price validation and decision-making.
Rely on a pricing system that incorporates financial conditions, market data from OTC and MSRB sources, and undergoes SOC 1 review for validated accuracy.
Leverage historical coverage dating back to 2011 for trend analysis, performance evaluation, and backtesting strategies.
Integrate data seamlessly via API, Cloud, or Feed, and access it through platforms like Snowflake, catering to diverse technical infrastructures.
Access comprehensive point-in-time data, including prices, yields, spreads, and benchmarks, allowing for precise historical analysis.
Explore municipal bonds across diverse sectors in the United States and Canada, providing a wide scope for investment analysis.

Product Overview.Overview: Municipal Bond Reference Data from S&P Global Market Intelligence provides validated and comprehensive reference information for 1 million active municipal bonds, covering over 55,000 issuers. This dataset delivers high-quality terms and conditions, incorporating 280 fields sourced from proprietary pre-trade data, official statements, and strategic partnerships.  It empowers users to effectively manage and optimize trade execution, risk assessment, and research activities, while also serving as a robust foundation for enterprise security masters with flexible daily or intraday data ingestion options.

Key Features.Description: Access validated reference data for 1 million active municipal bonds and 55,000 issuers, ensuring broad market insights.
Leverage 280 fields of detailed information to gain a deep understanding of municipal bond characteristics and nuances.
Rely on validated and accurate terms and conditions sourced from reliable sources for confident and informed decision-making.
Utilize detailed instrument flags to precisely identify and categorize different types of municipal bonds for targeted analysis.
Gain clear insights into issuers, obligors, and guarantors through key entity information, improving risk assessment and due diligence.
Employ tax type identifiers and flags to streamline operations and ensure regulatory compliance in tax-sensitive investments.
Ingest data seamlessly with daily or intraday delivery via API, Cloud, or Feed, adapting to your specific workflow needs.
Enhance trade execution, risk management, research, and security master maintenance with reliable and timely municipal bond data.

Product.Product Name: National and Regional Scale Credit Ratings

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Ratings' National and Regional Scale Credit Ratings offer a distinct perspective on creditworthiness, focusing on relative risk assessment within a specific country or region.  These ratings provide a rank ordering of credit risk, utilizing S&P Global Ratings' global symbols with a unique two-letter prefix to denote the specific scale. Designed for localized financial markets, these scales are not comparable across different countries or regions, offering a focused and nuanced understanding of credit risk within a defined geographic area.

Key Features.Description: National Scale Ratings provide a focused ranking of credit risk specifically within a country, offering a more relevant perspective for domestic markets.
Regional Scale Ratings extend this localized approach to groups of countries, enabling a comparative risk assessment within a broader region.
The use of two-letter prefixes with global rating symbols clearly indicates the specific national or regional scale being applied.
Designed for issuers and investors within specific countries or regions, catering to the nuances of local financial markets.
National and Regional scales work alongside global ratings, offering a multi-faceted view of creditworthiness.
Scales like the KSA scale provide a more granular differentiation of credit risk within specific markets like Saudi Arabia.
Methodology guidance and FAQs are available to enhance understanding and application of these specialized ratings.
Direct access to regional experts like Jawad Ameeri and Ahmed Alsada for further information and support.

Product Overview.Overview: Access comprehensive company data with this dataset, covering over 21,000 global companies across diverse industries including Consumer, Energy, Financials, Healthcare, Industrials, Materials, Real Estate, Technology, Media & Telecommunications.  Initiated in 2023, this point-in-time dataset offers daily updates and delivers 10s of fields per company through Desktop, Feed, and platforms like S&P Capital IQ Pro, Snowflake, and Xpressfeed™.

Key Features.Description: Gain insights from data covering 21,000+ companies worldwide, offering a broad and comprehensive market view.
Analyze companies across key sectors including Consumer, Energy, Financials, and more, providing a holistic understanding of the global economy.
Benefit from daily reporting frequency and low latency, ensuring you have the most current information for timely decision-making.
Leverage point-in-time data capabilities to analyze company information at specific moments, ideal for historical comparisons and trend identification.
Access datasets with 10s of fields per company, providing depth and granularity for detailed analysis and modeling.
Integrate data seamlessly into your workflows with delivery options via Desktop, Feed, and leading platforms like S&P Capital IQ Pro and Snowflake.
Utilize data history initiated in 2023 for trend analysis and to understand company evolution over recent periods.

Product Overview.Overview: Nature risk is material and measurable, and S&P Global Sustainable1 provides comprehensive data intelligence to help businesses and financial institutions navigate this critical area.  Their Nature Positive solutions offer curated data and analytics to efficiently assess company operations, supply chains, and investment portfolios for nature and biodiversity risks. By understanding ecosystem footprints, dependencies, and alignment with frameworks like TNFD, organizations can gain essential insights to manage risks, identify opportunities, and contribute to a nature-positive economy.

Key Features.Description: Access curated and comprehensive Nature & Biodiversity Risk data to efficiently assess company operations, supply chains, and investment portfolios.
Understand the environmental impact of business operations with a metric that combines land impact, ecosystem degradation, and ecosystem significance for comparable analysis.
Identify potential risks by understanding asset locations in Key Biodiversity Areas (KBAs) and World Database on Protected Areas (WDPAs).
Measure business reliance on 21 ecosystem services and assess the associated resilience risk in operating locations worldwide.
Leverage data quantifying nature & biodiversity risk for over 20,000 companies, based on millions of underlying assets and comprehensive metrics.
Analyze nature & biodiversity risks to real assets within portfolios, operations, and supply chains by uploading location data for in-depth assessments.
Generate one-off reports aligned with TNFD recommendations, identifying nature & biodiversity risks across portfolios, operations, and supply chains.
Utilize a scientifically robust and actionable methodology, developed in collaboration with UNEP, for analyzing companies' impacts and dependencies on nature, aligning with TNFD frameworks.

Product Overview.Overview: Achieving net-zero carbon emissions is a critical global challenge, and this product provides the essential sustainability intelligence needed to navigate this complex journey. Offering unparalleled data and insights, it empowers businesses to accelerate their path to carbon neutrality. From quantifying carbon footprints and setting science-based targets to analyzing future climate scenarios and reporting progress, this comprehensive solution supports companies, financial institutions, and investors in making informed decisions and driving impactful action towards a sustainable, net-zero future.

Key Features.Description: Access a wide range of curated data covering nature risk, climate & environmental factors, energy transition, and physical risks to gain a holistic understanding of your sustainability landscape.
Provides tools and insights to define and implement your net zero strategy, from setting science-based targets to tracking progress and reporting, ensuring a structured approach to carbon reduction.
Identify and analyze climate-related risks and opportunities across your operations, supply chains, and investment portfolios for informed decision-making and strategic advantage.
Track your alignment with the Paris Agreement goals and identify necessary emission reductions to contribute to global climate targets, demonstrating commitment to international standards.
Uncover risk scenarios and transition pathways with in-depth data intelligence to optimize your net zero opportunities and future-proof your strategy against climate uncertainties.
Utilize innovative indices and second-party opinions to guide your net zero investment and financing strategies, aligning financial decisions with sustainability goals and investor expectations.
Streamline your TCFD reporting process with data-driven insights and meet increasing demands for transparency from stakeholders, enhancing trust and accountability.
Access essential sustainability data through streamlined platforms and benefit from expert specialist support to accelerate your net zero journey with confidence and efficiency.

Product Overview.Overview: We apologize for the inconvenience, but the system encountered an error while attempting to process your request.  This temporary issue prevents the request from being fulfilled at this time.  You are advised to try submitting your request again. If the problem persists, please reach out to our support team for further assistance.

Product Overview.Overview: The Net-Zero Commitments Tracker dataset, offered by S&P Global Sustainable1, provides a comprehensive view of corporate climate action by tracking companies' net-zero commitments, targets, and transition plans. This dataset enables users to assess the ambition and credibility of corporate climate targets, examine long-term emissions forecasts across Scopes 1, 2, and 3, and understand companies' progress against science-based pathways like IPCC and IEA models. It also offers insights into external verification of targets and the use of carbon offsets, facilitating benchmarking and informed decision-making for investors and stakeholders focused on corporate sustainability.

Key Features.Description: Access a centralized view of companies' net-zero commitments, interim targets, and emissions reduction plans across all scopes (1, 2, and 3).
Evaluate corporate climate target progress, with assessments indicating if companies are on track, at risk, already met, or not met in achieving their goals.
Determine if companies have secured external verification for their net-zero and interim targets, enhancing trust and credibility assessment.
Gain visibility into companies' reliance on carbon offsets and permanent removals as part of their net-zero strategies.
Compare commitments and progress across different companies and sectors to identify leaders and laggards in climate action.
Analyze long-term projections of Scope 1, 2, and 3 greenhouse gas emissions through 2050 for strategic foresight.
Track targets against recognized benchmarks like IPCC, IIASA, and IEA modeled pathways for credible alignment assessment.
Leverage data sourced from CDP, company reports, and S&P Global Environmental Data to support robust climate risk analysis and investment strategies.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Commodity Insights' Non-Ferrous Metals Market Insights provides essential intelligence for industry participants navigating the dynamic non-ferrous metals markets. This service delivers pricing, forecasting, and analytical solutions crucial for miners, producers, traders, manufacturers, and investors. Covering a wide range of metals including aluminum, copper, nickel, lithium, and more, it empowers users to strengthen their strategies, make confident trading decisions, optimize supply chains, and effectively manage risks in this critical sector.

Key Features.Description: Stay ahead with daily global news, data, insights, and expert analysis specifically focused on non-ferrous metals.
Analyze market dynamics with daily benchmark price assessments, including key indicators like the U.S. Aluminum Transaction price.
Gain instant access to the latest global price assessments, arbitrage opportunities, historical data, and fundamental market analysis.
Inform strategic decisions and mitigate risks with short to mid-term market trend analysis and forecasting reports.
Enable efficient decision-making and proactive risk management through real-time alerts on critical market movements and price updates.
Access historical, current, and forecast data, providing detailed coverage across key non-ferrous metal value chains.
Leverage monthly commodity briefing reports that include rolling 5-year supply, demand, and price forecasts for strategic planning.
Connect with industry experts and peers through client seminars, webinars, conferences, and direct access to S&P Global analysts.

Product Overview.Overview: The North American Power Analytics dataset, originating from IHS Markit and S&P Global, provides comprehensive energy market intelligence for the United States and Canada.  This dataset delivers extensive merit order curve data, detailed technology and market-level insights from various sensitivity cases (including wind, solar, battery, and natural gas price variations), and granular hourly data on prices, net loads, and generation by technology.  Spanning across over 20 regions and nearly 40 price points, and extending to 2050 with quarterly updates, this dataset is crucial for understanding and navigating the evolving North American power market.

Key Features.Description: Encompasses all technologies and regions in the United States and Canada, offering a holistic view of the North American power market.
Provides detailed technology and market-level data, including merit order curves, sensitivity case scenarios, and hourly price, load, and generation data.
Data extends to 2050, enabling long-term planning and strategic decision-making in the energy sector.
Updated quarterly with the latest Planning Case outlooks and sensitivity case outlooks, ensuring data reflects the most current market conditions.
Includes data from various sensitivity cases (wind, solar, battery, gas prices) to assess the impact of different market variables.
Covers over 20 regions and nearly 40 price points across the US and Canada, providing regional insights.
Accessible via API for efficient data integration and real-time analysis.
Originated from trusted sources IHS Markit and S&P Global Commodity Insights, ensuring data quality and credibility.

Product Overview.Overview: The North American Power and Renewables dataset, originating from IHS Markit and offered by S&P Commodity Insights, delivers comprehensive historical and forecast data for the power and renewables sector across the United States and Canada. Encompassing over 20 regions and nearly 40 price points, this dataset includes crucial information such as wholesale power and natural gas prices, energy and peak demand, capacity dynamics, and generation statistics. Updated semi-annually with the Planning Case outlook, it integrates the latest expert forecasts, providing vital insights for navigating the evolving energy landscape.

Key Features.Description: Data spans across the United States and Canada, covering over 20 regions for detailed regional analysis.
Includes wholesale power prices, natural gas prices, energy and peak demand, capacity additions and retirements, installed capacities, generation, and reserve margin.
Updated semi-annually with the Planning Case outlook, ensuring users have access to the most current market projections.
Sourced from IHS Markit and offered by S&P Commodity Insights, leveraging trusted expertise in energy and commodity markets.
Provides data history back to 2008 alongside future forecasts for comprehensive market understanding.
Accessible via API and Connect platforms, allowing for seamless integration into various workflows and systems.
Concentrates on the Energy and Utilities sectors, delivering targeted data relevant to these industries.
Offers data at hourly, monthly, and annual levels, enabling detailed temporal analysis.

Product Overview.Overview: Notice Manager is a secure and efficient platform designed for financial institutions to manage incoming bank loan agent notices. It streamlines operations for loan managers by providing a single platform to handle inbound notices, optimize workflows, and improve security. The service supports various data formats including FpML, faxes, and emails with attachments, offering tools for collaboration, historical research, and audit needs, ultimately enhancing day-to-day operations and data control for banks, investment firms, and more.

Key Features.Description: Achieve straight-through processing with proven FpML message routing and eliminate the need for physical storage by converting from manual to electronic filing.
Configure queue segmentation to automatically assign a facility to the appropriate operations team member, optimizing team workflows.
Tailor workflow steps based on your internal operational procedures and quickly search historical documents using diverse criteria for tailored operations.
Organize incoming notices by portfolio, received date, issuer, facility, activity type and effective date for improved document management and retrieval.
Utilize reporting tools to optimize workflow trafficking and identify notice processing bottlenecks, enabling process improvements.
Process incoming agent notices with greater than 99% accuracy, minimizing errors and ensuring data reliability in notice handling.

Product Overview.Overview: Offset Drilling Data, sourced from IHS Market, delivers comprehensive well histories encompassing reports and plots essential for comparing the performance and key drilling factors of adjacent wells across Canada and the lower-48 United States, including the Gulf of Mexico. This dataset offers quick access to well histories in a user-friendly format, facilitating informed decision-making, optimized well design strategies, and effective benchmarking. Furthermore, on-demand drilling curves are available for wells not already within the database, ensuring a broad and adaptable data resource.

Key Features.Description: Access comprehensive well histories in an easily digestible format for rapid analysis and review.
Benchmark well performance against nearby wells using detailed reports and plots, enabling comparative analysis and identification of best practices.
Inform and optimize well design strategies by leveraging granular drilling data insights into various drilling parameters and historical performance.
Make informed operational and strategic decisions leveraging critical drilling data to enhance efficiency and reduce risks.
Generate drilling curves on demand, extending data availability beyond pre-loaded wells and offering flexibility in analysis.
Includes vital drilling parameters such as Depth vs. Time Curves, Bit Records, ROP, NPT Events, Directional Surveys, Casing Depths, Mud Properties, Hydraulics, and Equipment.
Covers key North American oil and gas regions including Canada, lower-48 US states, and the Gulf of Mexico.
Access a rich historical dataset dating back to 1929, providing valuable context and long-term trend analysis capabilities.

Product.Product Name: Oil Markets, Midstream and Downstream (OMD) Data

Product Overview.Overview: The Oil Markets, Midstream and Downstream (OMD) Data, originating from IHS Markit and now offered by S&P Commodity Insights, provides comprehensive access to data series covering crude oil markets, midstream oil and NGLs, and refining and marketing. This dataset includes short and long-term outlooks, as well as extensive historical data, encompassing supply, demand, pricing, and capacities across nearly all commodities and markets. Leverage this dataset to gain critical insights into global energy markets, understand refinery operations, and inform strategic corporate decisions within the industrials sector.

Key Features.Description: Access data series across crude oil markets, midstream, and downstream sectors, providing a holistic view of the oil industry.
Includes over 60,000 unique series covering supply, demand, imports, exports, prices, and margins for nearly all commodities and markets.
Benefit from both short- and long-term outlooks as well as a rich history dating back to 1985, enabling trend analysis and forecasting.
Detailed data on refinery capacities, runs, and utilization rates to understand operational aspects of the refining industry.
Includes lubricants demand and fuel retail indicators, offering granular insights into specific market segments.
Dataset covers global geographic regions, providing a worldwide perspective on oil markets.
Delivered via API for seamless integration into existing systems and workflows.
Provided by S&P Commodity Insights, a trusted leader in energy and commodity market intelligence.

Product Overview.Overview: Platts Oil Risk Market Data, provided by S&P Global Commodity Insights, offers a comprehensive solution for navigating the complexities of the crude oil forward markets. With extensive coverage spanning over 350 crude oil forward curves and 15,000 data points across global markets, this product empowers professionals to confidently assess market values, manage risk, and optimize trading strategies.  Delivered through various platforms and backed by robust methodologies and expert analysis, it serves as an independent and verifiable source of data for informed decision-making in the dynamic oil sector.

Key Features.Description: Access over 350 crude oil forward curves and 15,000 data points across Asia, Europe, Middle East, Africa (EMEA), and Americas markets for in-depth market analysis.
Leverage advanced analytics for real-time insights into price movements and market trends, enabling proactive strategy adjustments.
Confidently assess market values of assets and liabilities, calculate key risk metrics, and manage counterparty credit exposure.

It encompasses a range of forward curve types, including editorially observed Platts Forward Curves (PFC), quantitatively derived M2M Forward Curves for illiquid markets, exchange-linked M2MS-Gas and Power curves, Intraday Oil Forward Curves for the Singapore market, and Follow the Sun global oil market assessments, providing a comprehensive view for informed decision-making in the evolving energy landscape.

Key Features.Description: Provides essential data for Profit & Loss valuations, risk management strategies, and fair value financial reporting.

M2MS-Gas and Power curves are derived from ICE trade settlement data, enhancing accuracy and market relevance.
