Product Overview.Overview: RiskGauge™ Desktop is a streamlined platform designed to provide a clear and comprehensive view of customer credit risk. It empowers organizations to assess, monitor, and manage credit risk for over 400 million companies globally through powerful analytical tools accessible in a single platform. By offering features like portfolio dashboards, company comparisons, and RiskGauge Scores and Reports, RiskGauge™ Desktop accelerates credit workflows, delivers pre-calculated risk metrics, and provides early warning alerts, enabling users to anticipate risks and opportunities across their entire customer base.

Key Features.Description: View your entire customer portfolio on a single, customizable dashboard, highlighting key performance indicators and trends for immediate understanding of overall credit health.
Stratify and drill down into your customer base by country, industry, and RiskGauge Score to quickly identify market changes and understand the drivers behind company risk status.
Analyze a company's credit risk against its peers using side-by-side views, leveraging proprietary methodology to identify relevant comparators and gain deeper insights.
Access extensive datasets and millions of pre-calculated RiskGauge Scores to easily score any customer, and seamlessly generate detailed credit reports for comprehensive analysis.

Generate on-demand, downloadable PDF reports providing historical performance, credit assessments, firmographics, and advanced features like MaxLimit and Macro Scenario Model for in-depth risk understanding.
Proactively identify potential credit deterioration with early warning signals and alerts, enabling timely intervention and risk mitigation across your portfolio.
Efficiently manage large portfolios of up to 500,000 companies within a single platform, reducing complexity and streamlining credit risk workflows.
Utilize the RiskGauge Score, a best-in-class, holistic scoring system with transparent risk drivers, to obtain reliable and consistent credit risk evaluations.

Product Overview.Overview: Stay ahead of the evolving powertrain market with the Sales-Based Powertrain Forecast. Designed for automotive suppliers, financiers, and media, this forecast provides critical insights into consumer sales demand beyond traditional production analysis.  Understand the impact of emissions policies, electrification trends, and charging infrastructure on powertrain sales across key global markets including the US, China, and Europe.  Leverage this detailed intelligence to inform your CO2 compliance strategies, identify growth opportunities in emerging fuel types, and navigate the complexities of regional market dynamics.

Key Features.Description: Plan for the future with a seven-year forecast, plus a 12-year extension, providing a long-term view of powertrain market evolution.
Analyze the market in detail with forecasts at the model, body type, and powertrain levels, enabling precise understanding of consumer preferences.
Rely on a common and consistent methodology applied across all covered markets for comparable and reliable data insights.
Ensure your analysis is always current with quarterly data updates, reflecting the latest market shifts and policy changes.
Access data and visualizations through Excel workbooks and Tableau, facilitating easy analysis and integration into your workflows.
Identify and capitalize on new market opportunities by understanding consumer demand trends and regional market variations.
Balance production and demand effectively with detailed forecasts at the body type, engine, and powertrain levels for efficient resource allocation.
Develop competitive regional product portfolio strategies by assessing powertrain technology demand and competitor actions.

Product Overview.Overview: CRISIL's Scenario Expansion Manager (SEM) Platform is an award-winning solution recognized as the Best Modelling Innovation in the Risk Markets Technology Awards 2021. Developed in collaboration with major global banks through the RISE consortium, SEM provides a centralized, transparent, and reusable framework for financial institutions to design, expand, analyze, and track both regulatory and internal stress testing scenarios. This platform streamlines the scenario expansion process, promotes industry best practices through scenario sharing, and ultimately reduces costs and operational risks associated with stress testing model development and validation.

Key Features.Description: Provides a single platform for designing, expanding, analyzing, and tracking all scenarios, enhancing efficiency and consistency.
Uses identified similarities to streamline the expansion process, saving time and resources in scenario development.
Offers a suite of analytical models for scenario expansion and model testing, ensuring robust and accurate stress testing results.
Facilitates data upload, input processing, and data quality checks, ensuring data integrity and accuracy for reliable modeling.
Provides transparent results, model documentation, and audit trails, reducing operational risk and simplifying model validation processes.
Enables secure sharing of internal scenarios between financial institutions, fostering industry best practices and reducing model development costs.
Supports both cloud-based and on-premise installation to accommodate diverse IT infrastructure and security requirements.
Streamlines post-expansion processes including review, approval, and audit trails, ensuring efficient scenario lifecycle management.

Product Overview.Overview: Script Insight is an innovative AI-powered tool designed for corporate issuers and investor relations teams to proactively analyze earnings call transcripts before they take place.  Leveraging S&P Global's Textual Data Analytics, this locally installed software provides sentiment, complexity, and transparency scores to help users identify potential messaging disconnects, simplify language, and enhance numeric transparency. By using Script Insight, companies can ensure consistent and effective communication with investors, ultimately improving investor perception.

Key Features.Description: Leverages S&P Global's Textual Data Analytics algorithm to score sentiment, complexity, and transparency of scripts.
Analyze earnings call transcripts before calls to proactively identify and address potential communication issues.
Locally installed software ensures data privacy and functionality even without internet connectivity.
Gauges positive-to-negative language ratio to optimize messaging for increased net positivity.
Measures reading comprehension level to help simplify language for better investor understanding.
Evaluates the frequency of numeric figures to enhance clarity and provide crucial financial details.
Compare communication effectiveness against industry peers to gain valuable context and identify areas for improvement.
Provides data-driven insights to empower decision-makers to refine communication strategies for enhanced investor relations.

Product Overview.Overview: SCRIPTS Asia Transcripts delivers comprehensive coverage of corporate events in the Asia Pacific region, specializing in non-English events from Japan and other key markets.  Gain access to English and original Japanese language transcripts of earnings releases, shareholder meetings, investor days, and more, providing crucial insights into companies operating in this dynamic region.  Leverage this data for sentiment analysis, proprietary metric development, and to identify sell-side analyst revisions, benefiting from intraday updates and historical data stretching back to 2018 across 2,000 entities.

Key Features.Description: Access transcripts from a wide range of corporate events across the Asia Pacific region, including Japan, providing deep insights into this critical market.
Utilize transcripts available in both English and the original Japanese language, enabling comprehensive analysis and broader accessibility for global teams.
Seamlessly link Speaker IDs to S&P Global Estimates and Professionals databases to easily identify and track sell-side analyst revisions and perspectives.
Receive intraday updates fully integrated within the Machine Readable Transcripts schema, ensuring access to the most current information available.
Explore a rich historical dataset extending back to 2018, covering 2,000 entities, enabling robust trend analysis and backtesting.
Leverage transcripts as a foundation for sentiment analysis and natural language processing, unlocking deeper qualitative insights from corporate communications.
Benefit from a dataset recognized for its excellence, including the 2020 Data Management Insight Award for Best Propositions for AI & Machine Learning.
Access data through diverse delivery channels and platforms such as Cloud, Desktop, Feed, FTP, Marketplace Workbench, S&P Capital IQ, S&P Capital IQ Pro, and Snowflake.

Product.Product Name: Second Party Opinions and External Reviews

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Ratings offers Second Party Opinions (SPOs) and European Green Bond (EuGB) External Reviews, providing independent, point-in-time assessments of sustainable finance instruments. SPOs analyze the sustainability aspects of Use of Proceeds and Sustainability-Linked Financing, utilizing the Shades of Green methodology for green projects to enhance transparency for investors seeking environmentally and socially responsible investments. EuGB External Reviews ensure alignment with the European Green Bond Regulation, offering pre-issuance, post-issuance, and impact report reviews to support market participants in navigating the sustainable finance landscape and demonstrating commitment to sustainability objectives.

Key Features.Description: Provides unbiased, point-in-time evaluations of sustainable finance instruments, enhancing market transparency.
Employs an award-winning methodology to evaluate the environmental robustness of green projects and their contribution to a low-carbon future.
Offers comprehensive reviews to ensure alignment with the European Green Bond Regulation, covering pre-issuance, post-issuance, and impact reporting.
Demonstrates alignment with relevant market standards such as ICMA, LMA, EU Taxonomy, and European Green Bond Regulation, increasing investor confidence.
Facilitates access to both public and private sustainable debt markets by providing credible external validation.
Helps companies clearly communicate and demonstrate their sustainability objectives and commitments to stakeholders.
Offers a streamlined and rigorous analytical process with typical delivery around 20 business days, and expedited options for time-sensitive cases.
Leverages a global team of experienced credit and sustainable finance analysts, combining deep sector expertise with climate science insights.

Product Overview.Overview: Securities Finance provides comprehensive global securities lending data and analytics, empowering financial professionals to effectively manage securities lending programs, optimize trading performance, and enhance investment decision-making.  This solution delivers unparalleled market transparency by aggregating data from over 650 industry participants, covering $38 trillion in global securities and offering 18 years of daily history.  By providing deep insights into market sentiment, collateral cash investments, repo activity, and short interest, Securities Finance equips users with the critical information needed to navigate and excel in the complex world of securities finance.

Key Features.Description: Gain a comprehensive view of the securities finance landscape with data spanning over $38 trillion in global securities.
Leverage 18 years of daily history to identify market trends, patterns and inform strategic decisions.
Access data sourced directly from 650+ leading industry participants, ensuring accuracy and real-world relevance.
Achieve superior visibility into market sentiment, trading activity, borrow costs, and collateral cash investments.
Refine trade entry and exit points, understand borrow availability, and benchmark your cost of carry to enhance trading performance.
Identify and track portfolio exposure to price reversals, short squeezes, and concentration risk for proactive risk mitigation.
Access comprehensive Repo data and analytics to gain a holistic understanding of funding and collateral markets.
Streamline your onboarding process with our new tool, enhancing efficiency and accelerating your time to value.

Product Overview.Overview: The Securities Finance: Program Management dataset from S&P Global Market Intelligence, formerly IHS Markit, provides comprehensive trading data and analytics designed to empower users in managing securities lending programs. Leveraging a proprietary and independent database tracking global securities finance supply, demand, fees, and market share since 2002, this dataset enables users to optimize trading strategies, make informed decisions, and effectively oversee risk and compliance within their securities finance operations.

Key Features.Description: Access extensive market data covering over $36 trillion in global securities lending programs, sourced directly from industry participants since 2002, providing a deep and historical perspective on market activity.
Utilize an independent securities finance database to track crucial metrics like supply, demand, fees, and market share, enabling objective performance benchmarking and program optimization.

Gain valuable insights into short interest dynamics, fund flow activity, and overall market sentiment through analytics reports, empowering trading desks to refine strategies and make data-driven decisions.
Compare loan rates and analyze market sentiment to improve price discovery for optimal trading outcomes in securities lending.
Oversee risk and compliance parameters with access to comprehensive data and analytics, supporting robust program management and regulatory adherence.
Streamline client onboarding processes for securities lending support teams with tools and data insights provided by the dataset.
Identify suitable ETF collateral options tailored to specific risk profiles and mandates, enhancing collateral management strategies.
Empower trading, sales, and lending teams with data-driven insights to support various functions, from trading strategy to client relationship management and risk assessment.

Product Overview.Overview: The Securities Finance: Repo Data Analytics dataset from S&P Global Market Intelligence provides critical data and analytics for participants in the global repo market.  This dataset enables users to gain investment insights through analysis of trade volumes and liquidity, enhance trading transparency via haircut and margin analysis, and improve price discovery by comparing repo rates against market benchmarks.  With extensive market coverage across numerous instruments and geographies, this dataset empowers informed decision-making and strategic advantage in repo trading.

Key Features.Description: Access daily data covering over $2.4 trillion in repo volumes across 13,000+ instruments, providing a comprehensive view of global market activity.
Gain detailed understanding of global trade volumes, liquidity dynamics, and rate variations across diverse markets, tenors, and haircuts.
Leverage data-driven analytics to uncover valuable investment insights into trade volumes and liquidity trends across various sectors.
Enhance trading transparency with granular haircut and margin analysis at the security and market level, improving risk management.
Improve price discovery capabilities by enabling comparison of repo rates against market standards and peer benchmarks.
Analyze repo market data across key regions including Asia-Pacific, Europe, the United States, and Canada for a worldwide perspective.
Explore data spanning multiple industries such as Consumer, Energy, Financials, Healthcare, Technology and more for sector-specific insights.
Receive daily data updates via Desktop, Feed, or SFTP for timely analysis and responsive decision-making in dynamic markets.

Product Overview.Overview: The Securities Finance: Short Interest dataset, derived from IHS Markit, delivers comprehensive insights into the global securities lending market and short interest dynamics. Covering over $39 trillion in global securities across 20,000 institutional funds, with 3 million daily transactions and history back to 2002, this dataset provides unparalleled transparency. Sourced directly from industry participants like Custodian Banks, Prime Brokers, and Hedge Funds, it empowers users to understand market trends, manage risk, and make informed investment decisions.

Key Features.Description: Gain a comprehensive understanding of the securities lending market and short interest dynamics.
Analyze over $39 trillion of global securities across a vast network of institutional funds.
Leverage history dating back to 2002 for long-term trend analysis and market context.
Access 3 million daily transactions for detailed, up-to-date market activity.
Analyze fund flow activity to inform strategic investment decisions and portfolio management.
Identify portfolio vulnerability to downward price reversals and potential short squeezes.
Assess the availability of securities for borrowing and the concentration of supply.
Combine securities lending flow with public short interest data for a complete market view.

Product Overview.Overview: Securities Processing, originating from IHS Markit and now offered by S&P Global Market Intelligence, is a comprehensive solution designed to streamline and optimize post-trade securities processing for organizations across various client types and business lines. It addresses the challenges of complex and fragmented post-trade architectures by offering a multi-entity platform with flexible account structures, supporting institutional custody, retail, and wealth management clients. This solution simplifies business architecture, enhances operational efficiency, and reduces operational risk through features like real-time management dashboards and industry-validated analytical tools, ultimately transforming the post-trade experience and lowering long-term total cost of ownership.

Key Features.Description: Supports institutional custody, retail, and wealth management clients on a single, common platform, simplifying business architecture.
Adapts to unique market requirements while establishing common services to optimize efficiency and minimize risk.
Provides user-friendly dashboards for operations staff to view and prioritize tasks with real-time risk profiles.
Streamlines the operating model through a digital client experience and automates end-to-end securities processing.
Lowers risk by minimizing data and processing errors, duplications, and delayed or missed events through process standardization.
Offers a cost-effective solution over time with a single code base shared across customers.
Delivers a cloud-native, open-architecture solution that digitizes the entire trade and asset-servicing lifecycle.
Shared common data layer for key functions reduces data replication and ensures data consistency across the enterprise.

Product Overview.Overview: The Securitized Products Pricing dataset, sourced from IHS Markit and offered by S&P Global Market Intelligence, delivers independent and transparent bid-offer pricing, analytics, and liquidity metrics for a vast universe of securitized products. This includes Agency and Non-Agency MBS, CLOs/CDOs, Consumer ABS, and other global ABS instruments.  Designed to bolster trading, risk management, and portfolio valuations, the dataset is built upon secondary market pricing and industry-standard methodologies, ensuring reliable and comprehensive data with historical coverage extending back to 2005. The service is also SOC1/SSAE16 compliant, providing added assurance.

Key Features.Description: Access pricing and analytics for over 1.4 million instruments, providing a comprehensive view of the securitized products market.
Leverage Liquidity Scores and transparency metrics on dealer quoting and trades to better understand market liquidity.
Benefit from historical coverage starting from 2005, enabling robust trend analysis and backtesting.
Utilize reliable, unbiased pricing data built on secondary market activity and industry-standard assumptions.
Gain insights into markets across Asia-Pacific, Europe, the United States, and Canada for a broad perspective.
Explore data across diverse sectors including Consumer, Financials, Energy, Technology, and more.
Integrate data seamlessly via API, Cloud, or Feed to suit various workflows and systems.
Receive intraday reporting frequency and dataset latency for timely, up-to-date market intelligence.

Product Overview.Overview: The Securitized Products Reference Data dataset, originating from IHS Markit and now offered by S&P Global Market Intelligence, provides comprehensive and in-depth information on a wide range of securitized instruments, including CLOs, CDOs, MBS, CMBS, and ABS.  Covering over 1.5 million active instruments, this dataset delivers extensive instrument details encompassing bond, collateral, and deal-level static and cashflow information. With historical cashflow data spanning more than 10 years and over 250 attributes, it empowers firms in key use cases such as security master maintenance, risk management, market surveillance, and pricing and valuation, ensuring access to accurate and up-to-date information for confident security trading and settlement.

Key Features.Description: Access comprehensive data across a broad spectrum of securitized product types including CLO, CDO, TruPS, Agency MBS, Agency CMO, Agency CMBS, Agency Reverse Mortgages, Non-Agency RMBS, Non-Agency CMBS, and other ABS.
Gain granular insights with extensive instrument details covering bond, collateral, and deal-level static and cashflow information.
Explore a wide market landscape with data spanning over 1.5 million active instruments, providing a comprehensive view of the securitized products market.
Leverage over 10 years of historical cashflow data for both non-pool and pool MBS, enabling robust trend analysis and backtesting.
Utilize a wealth of information with over 250 attributes, facilitating detailed analysis and model development.
Power critical financial applications including security masters, risk management, market surveillance, and pricing and valuation with reliable reference data.
Ensure accuracy in trading and settlement processes with access to current and dependable information.
Understand underlying asset performance with deep collateral information across types, payment speeds, and loss details.

Product Overview.Overview: This platform provides comprehensive intelligence on the global landscape of plant traits and seed technologies, focusing on GMOs and New Genomic Techniques (NGTs). Clients gain critical insights into R&D advancements, regulatory approvals, and market status across 27 crop categories and 50 countries. This enables informed decision-making for various use cases including export risk mitigation in grain trade, competitive intelligence in crop science, and ingredient sourcing for food manufacturers. By offering regular updates and tailored market news, the platform empowers users to navigate complex regulatory environments, anticipate market trends, and maintain a competitive edge in the evolving agricultural sector.

Key Features.Description: Understand GMO and NGT regulations worldwide, including country-specific status for import/export and cultivation, key regulatory bodies, and relevant laws to ensure seamless global operations and trade.
Stay informed about regulatory changes and market dynamics, enabling proactive risk management and strategic decision-making in response to evolving global standards.
Access focused reports and data on gene editing and NGT regulations, including key players, market forecasts, and regulatory landscapes, to inform strategic decisions in these emerging fields.
Anticipate market trends in seed technology with insights into market status and forecasts, gaining a competitive edge in the dynamic crop science industry.
Leverage detailed reports covering country-specific regulations for both GMOs and NGTs, offering a complete picture of the global regulatory environment.
Benefit from monthly updates to a comprehensive database of 2900+ GMOs and 500+ NGTs, ensuring access to the most current information.
Explore in-depth data on plant products and traits, including market status, breeding techniques, regulatory status, application type, and regulatory agency for informed analysis.
Receive a curated Crop Science Market Reporting news feed focused on input and output traits and new breeding techniques, keeping you updated on the most relevant industry developments.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Ratings' Servicer Evaluations are independent, objective assessments of a company's operational capabilities in handling loan and asset servicing. Introduced in 1989, these evaluations provide global market participants with insights into a servicer's strengths and risks through a comprehensive analysis conducted by expert analysts.  While not credit ratings, Servicer Evaluations offer overall and sub-rankings based on management, organization, and administrative processes, helping investors, issuers, bankers, and servicers understand and benchmark servicer performance and capabilities.

Key Features.Description: Gain a trusted, third-party perspective on a servicer's operational abilities, enhancing market transparency.
Benefit from a thorough assessment of a servicer's management, organization, administrative processes, and financial position.
Easily understand servicer capabilities through overall and sub-rankings presented in a detailed written report.
Investors can leverage Servicer Evaluations to identify and select well-performing servicers, mitigating risks and improving investment outcomes.
Issuers can boost the appeal of their transactions by partnering with highly-ranked servicers, signaling operational excellence.
Servicers can utilize evaluations to compare themselves to peers, identify areas for improvement, and raise their market profile.
Servicer Evaluations serve as a valuable tool for servicers to market their capabilities to originators and other stakeholders.
Stay informed of crucial servicer developments through continuous reviews and updates, ensuring a current perspective.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global's EU SFDR Reporting solution is designed to help financial market participants navigate the complexities of the Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation (SFDR). This regulation from the European Union mandates the disclosure of sustainability information for financial products, aiming to increase transparency and guide investors towards sustainable choices. Our solution offers comprehensive coverage of both mandatory and opt-in Principal Adverse Indicators (PAIs) across a wide range of companies and business activities, enabling businesses to effectively assess and disclose the sustainability alignment of their financial products and meet SFDR requirements.

Key Features.Description: Access data and analysis for both mandatory and opt-in Principal Adverse Indicators (PAIs) to meet all SFDR disclosure requirements.
Evaluate sustainability alignment across over 20,000 public and private companies, spanning 464 diverse business activities.
Analyze climate, environmental, social, human rights, anti-corruption, and anti-bribery indicators, covering all key aspects of SFDR.
Utilize indicators relevant to investments in sovereigns, supranationals, and real estate assets in addition to corporate investments.
Gain deeper insights into ESG performance to drive your broader sustainability strategy and meet evolving regulatory landscapes.
Connect sustainability data with financial data and market intelligence for a holistic and comprehensive perspective.
Access data through various methods including desktop solutions, APIs, data feeds, and cloud access to suit your workflow needs.
Rely on S&P Global's 20+ years of experience, cutting-edge technology, and dedicated 24/7 customer support for robust and reliable SFDR reporting.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Shades of Green Company Assessments offer independent, research-driven evaluations of a company's environmental impact and transition efforts, utilizing the renowned Shades of Green methodology. Launched in 2020, these assessments provide a detailed analysis of corporate activities, grounded in climate science. They serve as a practical tool for investors, lenders, and public authorities to understand climate risk, prepare for green equity listings and IPOs, facilitate EU Taxonomy reporting, and enhance corporate sustainability transparency.

Key Features.Description: Obtain credible, third-party research-based assessments of company green activities.
Benefit from a nuanced evaluation system that goes beyond binary classifications of greenness.
Rely on assessments built on robust climate science for accurate and reliable insights.
Understand the strength of a company's environmental governance through a clear and concise score.
Gain clarity on alignment with EU Taxonomy requirements, including DNSH and minimum safeguards.
Easily compare company progress with included environmental performance indicators.
Prepare for and support applications for Nasdaq and B3 Green Equity Designations.
Utilize assessments for IPO readiness, investor communication, and comprehensive climate risk understanding.

Product Overview.Overview: The Ship Compliance dataset from S&P Global Market Intelligence, originating from IHS Markit, offers comprehensive screening data on vessels for international sanctions, ownership, registration, and class compliance. This dataset allows users to track vessels for various compliance risks, including sanctions violations, suspected illicit activities, port calls to sanctioned countries, and ownership-related compliance issues. By leveraging this dataset, users gain insights into current and historical compliance statuses, dating back to July 2007, and can integrate this data with other datasets using the LR IMO Ship No. for a holistic view.

Key Features.Description: Identifies vessels with severe compliance issues, warnings, or clear statuses based on screening against international sanctions lists and advisories.
Provides worldwide data coverage, ensuring comprehensive monitoring of ship compliance across various geographic regions.
Includes historical coverage from July 2007, enabling trend analysis and long-term compliance monitoring for vessels.
Screens vessels for suspected dark activities, enhancing risk assessment and compliance monitoring capabilities.
Tracks vessel port calls to sanctioned countries, helping users identify potential compliance breaches related to geographic restrictions.
Monitors flag-related compliance issues, ensuring adherence to international maritime regulations associated with vessel flags.
Delivers current and historical ownership information and parent company compliance details, providing a complete view of vessel ownership structure for compliance assessment.
Links to the Ships dataset via LR IMO Ship No., facilitating seamless integration and a comprehensive understanding of vessel information by combining datasets.

Product Overview.Overview: The Ship Movements dataset, originating from IHS Markit and now offered by S&P Global Market Intelligence, provides comprehensive global coverage of ship movements using combined satellite and land-based AIS data. This dataset enables users to track various aspects of vessel activity, including port and anchorage callings, current port presence, berth callings, and AIS positions, in both terrestrial and combined formats.  It includes historical data and allows integration with GIS systems for detailed maritime analysis.

Key Features.Description: Access the largest global provider of combined satellite and land-based AIS data for comprehensive ship tracking across the globe.
Track various ship activities including port callings, anchorage visits, berth engagements, and real-time AIS positions for a holistic view.
Monitor ships currently in port to understand real-time port activity and vessel presence.
Utilize the included Ship Movements History dataset to analyze past vessel patterns and trends.
Seamlessly integrate ship movement data into your Geographic Information Systems for spatial analysis and enhanced visualization.
Benefit from combined Terrestrial and Satellite AIS data for superior coverage, especially in remote or oceanic regions.
Receive frequently updated data with daily reporting frequency, ensuring timely insights into ship movements.
Leverage data from S&P Global Market Intelligence, a recognized leader in providing accurate and insightful market intelligence.

Product Overview.Overview: The Shipping Factors dataset, part of the Alpha Signals library, delivers comprehensive, quantitative insights into company supply chains. Derived from Bill of Lading data covering US ports, it offers a timely view of global import and export activities. This dataset provides factors covering shipping details, trends, revenue impact, and geographic/product exposure, enabling users to incorporate crucial supply chain intelligence into stock selection and risk models. Metrics are aggregated at the parent company level for a holistic understanding of shipping activity.

Key Features.Description: Access granular data on import and export volume, value, and weights for individual companies, providing a detailed view of their shipping activities.
Analyze shipping activity trends relative to previous months and benchmark against sector and industry peers to identify shifts and patterns.
Understand the sensitivity of each company's revenue to supply chain dynamics, based on both past sales and forward-looking estimates.
Identify company exposure to diverse geographical markets through their import and export activities, revealing key market dependencies.
Gain visibility into the concentration of product types imported and exported by each company, highlighting core business areas.
Benefit from data coverage on 9,000 companies globally, ensuring a broad and representative dataset for analysis.
Leverage historical data starting from 2007 for trend analysis and backtesting, providing a robust foundation for research.
Receive daily reporting frequency and dataset latency, ensuring timely access to the latest shipping factor information for informed decision-making.

Product Overview.Overview: Shipping Market Insights delivers comprehensive data and analytics for navigating the complexities of commodity flows, freight, and bunker fuel markets. Designed for stakeholders across the global commodity value chain, including traders, investors, and fleet operators, this portfolio provides critical insights into commodity movements, supply trends, fleet dynamics, and rate forecasts. It empowers users to make informed short-term decisions by illuminating the impacts of market shifts on operational costs and opportunities, covering a wide range of commodities and vessel types.

Key Features.Description: Access insights across a wide range of commodities including energy, industrial raw materials, food and feed, and bunker fuels, as well as all vessel types, ensuring a holistic view of the shipping market.
Utilize analytics-based, impartial freight market forecasts, developed with the Baltic Exchange and powered by machine learning, to navigate maritime volatility and support strategic decision-making.
Gain a comprehensive and unbiased evaluation of the dry freight market with daily price assessments, fundamental analysis, and independent freight rate updates from the Dry Freight Wire.
Leverage proprietary oil and trade flow data in the Freight Market Outlook Service to receive monthly reports and forecasts of tanker ton-mile demand and vessel demand in key tanker sectors.
Stay informed on global bunker fuel markets with daily snapshots featuring the latest prices for major ports, key market insights, and Platts price assessments.
Obtain a comprehensive understanding of market dynamics with consolidated data on routes, rates, vessel capacity, fuel costs, fuel availability, and freight supply and demand.
Access transportation analysts to address client questions related to the Freight Market Outlook Service, enhancing understanding and application of market insights.
Receive timely updates on end-of-day prices, regional analyses, and transparent benchmark assessments, ensuring you have the latest market information for critical negotiations.

Product Overview.Overview: The Ships dataset from IHS Markit provides comprehensive maritime intelligence, offering indispensable information on over 220,000 ships, 300,000 companies, and 16,000 ports and terminals worldwide. This dataset empowers businesses to make critical decisions across supply chain, logistics, compliance, defense, procurement, and commercial strategies. It enables users to analyze fleet performance, confirm ship identities and ownership structures, assess risk through historical and real-time data, and gain valuable insights for strategic advantage and operational efficiency in the maritime industry.

Key Features.Description: Access data on over 220,000 ships globally, including those in service, broken up, under construction, and newbuildings, providing a comprehensive view of the world's fleet.
Explore information on over 300,000 companies and 16,000 ports and terminals, offering a holistic understanding of the maritime ecosystem beyond just vessels.
Compare fleet performance, operations, and competitor activities to gain insights into industry trends and optimize your own strategies.
Confirm ship identities and details, including ownership structures up to seven levels, ensuring accuracy for compliance and risk assessment.
Utilize current and historic ship and ownership data, including port state control and casualty information, for robust risk analysis and domain awareness.
Benefit from the highest level of accuracy and depth of coverage for vessel characteristics and the global newbuilding book, ensuring reliable data for critical decisions.
Access 500,000 images and dynamic links to comprehensive ship and port details, enhancing data exploration and understanding.
Rely on the sole originating source for assigning IMO Ship and Company numbers, ensuring data consistency and industry-wide recognition.

Product Overview.Overview: The Short Sentiment Factors dataset from S&P Global Market Intelligence provides unique insights into global market sentiment by leveraging a proprietary securities finance dataset.  Collected directly from market participants and covering $36 Trillion in inventory across global markets with contributions from 98% of prime brokers, this dataset offers daily signals for detecting negative sentiment and illuminates the traditionally opaque securities lending market. It delivers frequently updated metrics such as utilization, demand/supply, borrow rates, and concentration, making it a more timely and insightful indicator compared to delayed exchange data.

Key Features.Description: Gain a competitive edge with insights derived from a unique Securities Finance dataset collected directly from market participants.
Access a comprehensive view of global markets, encompassing $36 Trillion in inventory and contributions from 98% of prime brokers.
Identify negative sentiment signals earlier than traditional exchange data, enabling proactive risk management and informed decision-making.
Illuminate the opaque securities lending market with daily data on supply, demand, borrow rates, and market shares.
Benefit from daily data updates, ensuring you have the most current information for timely analysis and strategy adjustments.
Utilize essential metrics like utilization rates, implied loan rates, and concentration metrics to gauge market sentiment effectively.
Analyze trends and patterns with historical data dating back to 2007, providing a long-term perspective for your analysis.
Leverage daily point-in-time factor values delivered via cloud or feed for seamless integration into your workflows and models.

Product Overview.Overview: The Short Squeeze Model dataset is a daily-updated multifactor model designed to predict short squeeze events. Leveraging proprietary transaction-level data and event indicators, it identifies catalysts and stocks at risk of a squeeze. Based on the hypothesis that capital constraints on short sellers increase squeeze likelihood, the model enhances short interest signal accuracy and provides deeper insights into short positions, helping users understand and anticipate potential market squeezes.

Key Features.Description: Gain insights from globally computed factors derived from proprietary transaction information, providing a unique perspective on short selling activities.
Access daily updated distributions of profitability for stocks on loan, offering a view into the financial pressures on short sellers.
Utilize a comprehensive score that combines capital constraints and event data to rank the likelihood of a squeeze event for different stocks.
Obtain detailed information on capital constraints and market sentiment to understand the underlying dynamics influencing squeeze potential.
Effectively identify stocks that are at an elevated risk of experiencing a short squeeze, enabling proactive trading strategies.
Enhance the reliability of short interest signals for more informed decision-making in short selling and related strategies.
Achieve a more profound understanding of short positions beyond traditional metrics, uncovering nuanced aspects of market sentiment and risk.
Benefit from daily data updates, ensuring access to the most current information for timely analysis and reaction to market changes.

Product.Product Name: SMART – Digitizing financial research and spreading workflows

Product Overview.Overview: SMART Platform is a web-based solution designed to digitize and streamline research and spreading processes for financial professionals. It offers an end-to-end platform with R2R capabilities, unifying various data forms like company financials, industry data, and alternative datasets under a single taxonomy.  SMART Platform enhances efficiency in coverage ramp-up, earnings season management, and data governance, providing tools for standardized spread management, auto-generated earnings commentary, and seamless connectivity with other applications.

Key Features.Description: End-to-end digitization of research and spreading workflows, enhancing efficiency and accuracy.
Hosts and analyzes diverse data types (financials, operational metrics, industry data, ESG) under a single, unified taxonomy.
Enables quicker expansion of equity and credit coverage for research and investment activities.
Accelerates model updates and report generation during peak earnings seasons.
Generates earnings commentary automatically, linked to model estimates for quick insights.
Provides superior data governance with audit trails, model archival, and custom validation rules.

Product Overview.Overview: This index strategy is designed as an alternative benchmark to traditional regional indices, focusing on reducing carbon intensity by 20-50% while maintaining low tracking error. It is also suitable as a secondary benchmark alongside major market indices, particularly for asset owners with significant global assets seeking to integrate carbon considerations into their investment strategies. The index leverages the S&P Carbon Global Standard for company carbon intensity comparisons and filters for best-in-class performers, making it a robust tool for low-carbon investing.

Product Overview.Overview: S&P Global Climanomics is a science-backed climate risk analytics platform designed to empower organizations to make informed decisions for a resilient future. Developed by climate experts and data scientists at S&P Global Sustainable1, Climanomics provides an easy-to-use solution to identify, measure, and understand climate risk across assets, businesses, and investment portfolios.  By embedding critical climate data into economic decision-making, Climanomics accelerates the equitable transition to a low-carbon economy, enabling users to put a price on the impact of physical climate risks and navigate the challenges of a changing planet with confidence.

Key Features.Description: Quickly generate actionable insights into potential future climate outcomes using industry-standard scenarios (SSPs & RCPs), essential for TCFD reporting and strategic planning.

Product.Product Name: S&P Paris-Aligned and Climate Transition (PACT) Indices

Product Overview.Overview: The S&P Paris-Aligned and Climate Transition (PACT) Indices are designed to measure the performance of equity securities selected and weighted to be compatible with a 1.5°C global warming climate scenario.  These indices, encompassing both the Climate Transition and the more ambitious Paris-Aligned series, go beyond standard ESG considerations by incorporating specific business activity exclusions, UNGC principles adherence, and ESG controversy screens.  They are engineered to meet the minimum standards for EU Climate Transition Benchmarks (EU CTBs) and EU Paris-aligned Benchmarks (EU PABs), aligning with the Paris Agreement and addressing greenwashing concerns, while providing investors with transparent and innovative index solutions from S&P Dow Jones Indices.

Key Features.Description: Track investments aligned with a 1.5°C global warming trajectory, directly supporting the goals of the Paris Agreement.
Meet or exceed the minimum standards for European Union Climate Benchmark labels (EU CTBs and EU PABs), ensuring regulatory alignment.
Support investments that align with the recommendations of the Taskforce on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD), promoting transparency and risk management.
Designed to maintain broad and diversified exposure while incorporating climate objectives, staying close to the parent index.
Provide a pre-screened universe of securities suitable for active management strategies focused on climate transition.
Serve as benchmarks for actively managed ESG strategies, offering a robust and climate-focused performance measure.
Function as underlying indices for passive funds, structured products, and other financial instruments seeking climate alignment.

Product Overview.Overview: The S&P Scored & Screened Indices, formerly known as S&P ESG Indices, are broad-based, market capitalization-weighted indices designed to measure the performance of securities from an underlying index that meet specific sustainability criteria.  These indices target 75% of the float-adjusted market capitalization within each GICS Industry Group, using S&P DJI ESG Scores derived from the S&P Global Corporate Sustainability Assessment (CSA).  They also incorporate exclusions based on business activities, adherence to the UN Global Compact, and ESG controversies, all while aiming to maintain similar industry group weights to their underlying indices. Offered by S&P Dow Jones Indices, a leading provider of iconic and innovative index solutions, these indices bring transparency and expertise to global capital markets.

Product Overview.Overview: The Textual Data Analytics (TDA) dataset, available on the S&P Capital IQ Workbench, offers a unique lens into company communications by providing sentiment and behavioral metrics derived from earnings call transcripts using Natural Language Processing.  Encompassing over 800 rigorously researched predictive and descriptive metrics for 11,600+ active global companies dating back to 2004, TDA enables users to go beyond traditional financial analysis. It allows for the assessment of sentiment, transparency, and communication styles expressed in earnings calls, facilitating the identification of alpha-generating signals and enhancing quantitative investment strategies by leveraging textual data insights.

Key Features.Description: Gain nuanced understanding of company sentiment with metrics like Bag-of-Words, TF-IDF, and Cosine Similarity, capturing varied dimensions of textual tone.

Identify and measure sentiment specifically around key financial topics like "Revenue" and "EPS," directly linking textual cues to financial outcomes.
Objectively assess executive communication and overall earnings call performance to understand communication effectiveness over time.
Analyze 11,600+ active companies worldwide across diverse industries, providing a broad and representative dataset for global analysis.
Leverage 800+ predictive and descriptive metrics derived from advanced Natural Language Processing to identify potential market-moving signals.

Access data through Cloud, Feed, FTP, Marketplace Workbench, Snowflake, and Xpressfeed™, ensuring seamless integration into your preferred workflow.

Product Overview.Overview: The Totem dataset, originating from S&P Global Market Intelligence (formerly IHS Markit), is a consensus-based independent price verification (IPV) service. Contributed by leading investment banks and market participants, Totem enables financial institutions to verify Profit & Loss, meet regulatory obligations, and enhance valuation accuracy by leveraging an independent, industry-backed benchmark.

Key Features.Description: Obtain consensus-based valuations from top financial institutions for independent verification of Profit & Loss and to meet regulatory requirements.

Product Overview.Overview: The Trucost Carbon Earnings at Risk dataset, offered by S&P Global Sustainable1, is designed to empower users to evaluate company-level vulnerability to both present and anticipated carbon pricing landscapes.  It leverages the crucial concept of Unpriced Carbon Cost, representing the gap between current carbon expenses and potential future costs under various climate scenarios, to facilitate this assessment. By utilizing this dataset, you can effectively stress-test a company's resilience to future carbon prices, gain insights into potential earnings at risk from carbon pricing at a portfolio level, and fulfill stakeholder reporting obligations aligned with the Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) recommendations.

Key Features.Description: Conduct in-depth scenario analysis to develop forward-looking estimates of financial risk associated with carbon pricing.

Examine the prospective financial repercussions of carbon prices across both individual constituents and entire portfolios under diverse scenarios.
Generate forward-looking financial risk estimates, directly supporting reporting in accordance with the Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures (TCFD).
Develop crucial forward-looking assessments of financial risk related to carbon pricing, enabling proactive strategies.
Gain clear insights into potential earnings that are at risk due to evolving carbon pricing mechanisms and scenarios.

Product Overview.Overview: The Trucost Metals and Mining Climate Competitiveness dataset provides a comprehensive assessment of climate-related risks within the metals and mining industry.  It evaluates carbon pricing risk, water stress risk, and future commodity market alignment at both asset and company levels.  This dataset enables users to identify potential financial costs associated with climate risks and understand how well-positioned mining assets are in the transition to a low-carbon economy, covering 1,400 assets across 500+ companies globally and spanning 15 base and precious metals.

Product Overview.Overview: The Trucost Paris Alignment dataset assesses company-level alignment with the Paris Agreement's goal to limit global warming to well below 2°C. This dataset empowers users to track portfolio alignment with Paris Agreement objectives and identify the scale of emission reductions required by 2030 and beyond, facilitating informed investment and strategic decisions in the face of climate change.

Key Features.Description: Evaluate company performance against the ambitious climate goals of the Paris Agreement.
Understand company decarbonization strategies through a rigorous transition pathway analysis.
Access medium-term projections and historical emissions data to track company progress.
Analyze the Paris Alignment of 19,000 companies worldwide.
Pinpoint companies and sectors leading the transition to a low-carbon economy.
Monitor and benchmark investment portfolios against climate change scenarios.
Identify the scale of reductions needed to meet 2030 and beyond targets.
Utilize analytical tools to quantify and track energy transition progress.

Product Overview.Overview: The U.S. Drilling and Development Activity dataset, originating from IHS Markit and offered by S&P Commodity Insights, provides a comprehensive view of drilling and rig market activity in the United States and Canada. Product Overview.Overview: The Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) is the leading benchmark for gauging global market volatility, widely recognized as the "fear gauge." It provides a real-time measure of market expectations for near-term volatility conveyed by S&P 500 index option prices.  VIX is crucial for investors as it reflects market sentiment, anticipates potential market swings over the next 30 days, and serves as a tool for risk management and portfolio diversification.

Key Features.Description: VIX is the globally recognized benchmark for measuring market volatility and investor sentiment in the U.S. equity market.
It projects market volatility for the next 30 days, offering a timely perspective on expected market fluctuations using S&P 500 options.
Calculated from S&P 500 options, VIX reflects volatility expectations for a broad and representative segment of the U.S. stock market.
VIX levels effectively reflect investor anxiety and uncertainty, typically increasing during market downturns and decreasing during stable periods.
Volatility, as measured by VIX, can be traded as an asset class, offering opportunities for portfolio diversification and potentially uncorrelated returns.
VIX and related financial products are widely utilized by investors to hedge against potential equity market downturns and manage overall portfolio risk.
Investors can leverage VIX-linked products such as ETFs, ETNs, futures, and options to speculate on anticipated changes in market volatility for potential profits.
VIX is calculated with a well-defined, transparent, and rigorous methodology using real-time S&P 500 index option prices, ensuring reliability and accuracy.

Key Features.Description: Provides immediate valuation adjustments, enabling faster and more informed trading decisions.
Delivers a complete picture of valuation adjustments, including CVA, FVA, ColVA, and regulatory capital impacts.
Offers a flexible and scalable cloud platform accessible via an intuitive UI, ensuring rapid calculations.
Allows for full transparency into inputs, outputs, and intermediate results for thorough analysis and validation.
Calculates both risk-neutral XVAs and real-world PFE consistently within a single system, streamlining workflows.
Enables deal-time SA-CVA calculations, providing a competitive advantage in trade decisions related to capital return.
Offers a user-friendly platform with rapid deployment and a proven track record of project acceleration.
Cloud infrastructure scales to meet fluctuating demands, with a pay-as-you-go model optimizing cost efficiency.
